Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near Penn Station and NYC's best”
Reviews.Author: jm1872a
Reviews.Content: Growing up in NJ, I had never spent an overnight in NYC at a hotel before this experience. What I had heard about NYC hotels is that they were either outrageously expensive, or cheap and crappy. However, this was the best of both worlds. Situated just blocks from Penn Station, MSG, and other NYC landmarks, this hotel is a great homebase for a trip to NYC. Subway lines are closeby too. Room was small-ish, but that's to be expected in NYC. Overall a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel for a visiting niece seeing a concert at MSG.”
Reviews.Author: Eleganceamust
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my 20-year-old niece and her friend who were seeing a concert at Madison Square Garden. They were in from Chicago just for the show and this hotel was very convenient to the venue. We arrived with them at the hotel to make sure they were taken care of and everything went very smoothly. It is a younger person's hotel or those on a budget. The staff greeted everyone with warm chocolate chip cookies. The girls loved that! We checked them in swiftly and took them up to the room. It was very small but fine for two college girls. It was very clean, but the bathroom could have been updated a little more...a lot of wear. The view...eh...not really. The girls said they had no problems sleeping there it all went great. I think this hotel is on an ugly street alas... However, if you need a hotel that will not break the bank...I booked it for $159.00 a night which is GREAT for Manhattan....then this place is for you...like I said...younger kids and budget minded folks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service makes for a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Westies88
Reviews.Content: The room was small but very clean and nicely decorated. Staff iis friendly and helpful. Price was a liitle high, but it was a last minute trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NavY3
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York on 5 March 2012 for a 5 night stay at the Doubletree Chelsea. We arrived around 3/4pm to check in. Our room was not ready and we were told to wait without being offered a drink despite the staff knowing that we had travelled from London and were exhausted. When we asked about being allocated a room with a view we were told these rooms were charged at a higher rate than the smoking room we had been allocated. A member of our party has severe asthma and at the time of our booking with Hotels.com no option was provided to pick a non-smoking room. Unfortunately the staff at the front desk were initially not very accommodating and insisted that we could stay in the room allocated; pay an upgrade fee for another room or find somewhere else to stay. Having travelled a fair bit and being Hilton Honours Members we found this to be unacceptable. We told staff we would wait for our room to be prepped and if the smoke was too bad we would consider paying the upgrade fee. After around 30 minutes of waiting we asked whether we could be offered a drink as we were very tired. We were shown into the hotel restaurant and by some stroke of good fortune here we met Peter the General Manager of the hotel and from hereon our luck changed. Peter was AMAZING. We were offered complimentary drinks and he joined us at our table to advise us of places to visit and things to do during our stay. We told Peter of our problem with the smoking room and without a second thought he walked into the reception area and returned within minutes to tell us he had changed our room without charge. We were shown to our room shortly thereafter and were given the Hilton cookies everyone raves about. They weren't warm but they were yummy. The room was adequately sized with great views of the Empire State Building. The beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean although the quilt / bedding could have been cleaner! The tv was a 42" flat screen and a small amount of storage space was provided with a safe which we did use during our trip. The bathroom was clean with great complimentary toiletries. However, the fixtures and fitting were tired looking and needed a once over. The hotel is located within a few minutes walk of 28th St subway (on the red line) and 34th Penn station (on the red and blue lines) which is very handy. All of the major sites are a short train ride away and as the hotel is away from the crazy hustle and bustle it is in the perfect location. The following morning there was no water in the shower. We were told this was due to a fire in the area and were offered a complimentary breakfast. The food options were limited but the staff did make us toast and bring us peanut butter when we asked which was brilliant. Peter then joined us at our table to help us plan our itinerary. We do think that a lot of the staff noted that Peter was taking care of us and perhaps this is why they were overly nice to us during our trip?! Can't say for certain but we certainly received a warmer welcome than the one we recieved when we first arrived. Despite the above we can say we received exceptional service during our stay by those members of the Hilton Team who took time out to talk to us. Peter is amazing and thanks to him and his suggestions we had a fantastic stay in NYC and at the Hilton Doubletree Chelsea. Ben at the concierge desk was super friendly with helpful suggestions about what to do. He was very charming and funny and certainly brightened our mornings. Miguel who is usually at the hotel in the evenings is one of the nicest people you will meet! He too was very helpful with suggestions on where to go and where not to go; he gave us more warm cookies without us asking; helped us find pizza at 2am and had this sent to our room and when a member of our party was unwell during the last night of our stay he immediately went to a nearby store and brought her tea with Lemon and Honey and brought this to our room. This was truly exceptional service and we can't than Miguel enough for this. Cathy was also very helpful so a special thanks to her also. All in all we will definitely be back to stay. However next time we will be sure to email the hotel in advance to secure a non-smoking room. A big thank you to Peter, Miguel, Ben and Cathy. You turned our trip from a good one into a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend, great location . . .”
Reviews.Author: NikonD5000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent last weekend at the Doubletree Chelsea. For our purposes it was perfectly located -- we walked the three blocks from Penn Station after arriving on Amtrak. From the hotel we walked to Times Square (to the TKTS booth and Colony Music), to the Highline, to the FIT Museum, to the Chelsea art district, and (on our last night) to Eataly down on 5th and 23rd. For everything else (Greenwich Village and Soho) we took the subway -- the 1 train on 7th Avenue and the N train on Broadway -- both with stations only two blocks away. We arrived at 11 AM but the very courteous people at the front desk in the tiny lobby found a room for us right away. We were up on the 19th floor in the back. No exterior noise at all, except for a couple of faint sirens. The room was New-York-snug and had only one chair (at the desk) but the bed was super comfortable and getting hot water in the bathroom and shower was almost instantaneous. And since I'm used to hotel and motel showers that spray directly into my chest (I'm 6'4"), it was nice to be able to stand directly under this one. One gripe is that there isn't much room for toiletries. For us it was mostly a place to sleep -- or, given all the walking we did, to collapse. Never even turned on the TV. For breakfast we ate at Guy & Gallard down the street the first morning and at the hotel the second. Preferred the G&G but the hotel one was fine. The only real complaint was that we could hear people talking in the corridor pretty clearly -- even to follow their jokes! We had a couple of rooms of twenty-somethings down the hall who were noisily preparing for a night out (I think they propped their doors open) and I was concerned about the noise they'd make when they returned, especially late. But either I slept through it or they were respectful and quiet. Still, it could be an issue. I'm surprised that nobody's mentioned that the hotel is in -- or at the southern edge of -- the Garment District. The blocks around it are lined with shops selling purses (mostly from China), wigs, belts, and other fashion items. The shops are definitely not glitzy and some sell only to the trade but I had trouble getting my wife to pass some of them by -- even when we were setting off to visit Mood's, the fabric supplier of Project Runway (eight blocks away). And one block south (28th Street) is the Flower District. The room was spotless, the bath towels big and fluffy, and the elevators (once they arrived -- there are only two) quiet and quick. I take lots of pictures (in this case, more than 600 in two days) and I love urban streetscapes. The Doubletree's neighborhood isn't pretty but for me at least it was a great place to walk around and shoot all the restaurants, delis, garment shops, flower sellers, neon signs, iconic rooftop water tanks, and subway stations, as well as the people who were passing by. Even at night. The next time we go to New York (we go once every year or two), the Doubletree will definitely be the first place we consider staying at.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location great staff”
Reviews.Author: nicola d
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the double tree in chelsea nyc for 4 nights last week.... The first thing i would say is the lobby is tiny and upon arriving was packed full of people leaving and after a 12 hour journey my temper was somewhat frayed.....the wait for the lift was a nightmare and not even an offer of help with bags........but the porter was busy so i let it go..... we at first didnt get the room we booked as we had paid extra for an empire state view and king sized bed.....we didnt get either but this was the fault of the travel agent not the hotel and the hotel staff sorted this out for us quickly..... our room was comfortable and clean and had great air con (we arrived on an unusually hot day for the time of year) i didnt think our room was small at all (anyone who says this has clearly never stayed in a hotel in london city centre!!) there was plenty of room to move about and plenty of cupboard space. the hotel is less than 10 minutes walk from times square, about 5 minutes from the empire state building and very close to subway and train stations!!! its such a good location and there were plenty of places to eat and drink about the hotel. the bar and breakfast staff were super efficient and very friendly and deserve a special mention!! as well as the housekeeping staff who kept us stocked in clean towels etc my main gripe with the hotel i suppose would be the tiny lobby area and the fact you cant get room service after 11 pm which isnt great if you miss dinner after being at a show but its hardly a major issue in a city with plenty of 24 hour delis

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to sleep...”
Reviews.Author: SidneyXVIII
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cramped - lobby is small and furnishings are minimal. There are only two elevators and one was broken for part of the time. There were often tours that arrived and jammed the lobby area. It only made the evelvator problem worse. The room furnishings were limited - a long cabinet served as a closet, the bathroom had no space to put down a cosmetic bag. The cleanliness was just ok. When I am paying for a hotel room, I would like it to be spotless even if it isn't the most expensive hotel. The internet service was spotty - I kept loosing the connection. I will say that the staff was very pleasant and helpful. The general location of the hotel also leaves a lot to be desired. We walked around the area one evening and felt unsafe. We thought we needed to be in this location because I was talking my daughter to visit Fashion Institute of Technology. In the future I would stay further uptown and take the subway to Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: LaylaAnn65
Reviews.Content: Many major attractions within walking distance especially MSG and Macy's The room was clean and well appointed and quiet but cramped for our family of 4, longer than a 2 night stay may be unnerving. The lobby/counter staff was warm and friendly. No issues with elevators. We appreciated the post-checkout baggage storage. Our daughters enjoyed the warm cookies!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Midtown!”
Reviews.Author: CraigVegas
Reviews.Content: Somehow I found a quiet room in Midtown Manhattan! Every time I've been to New York, I've always had trouble sleeping because of the noise of city life. No problems at all at this hotel! The room wasn't big, but my suitcases fit just fine, and I didn't feel claustrophobic at all. Check-in & out and baggage storage staff were friendly and quick. I took the train from Newark into Penn Station and walked the 4 minutes or so to the hotel. The location is absolutely excellent! I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wi-fi, Refilling your Water Bottle, Slow Elevators (Feb 2012)”
Reviews.Author: xsharkfin
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and comfort. But here's what you really need to know: wi-fi is complimentary in the lobby and front entrance (outside), room Internet via LAN is $$$$ minute! The Business Centre is available 24/7 but only 2 computers. Use the 24/7 gym to refill your water bottle with purified water (hot or cold). Concierge tries to be helpful but you're better off getting your own Broadway tickets from TKTS for precise cost and availability. Only 2 elevators for a 20+ story (with 10 units per floor?) building and MANY people complained about how slow it was but what do you expect? Safe neighbourhood, clean facilities, ++ location. Tip is expected at the end of your trip, perhaps 15-20% because the staff work hard! At the time I was there, lots of French and German travellers, a few children, rich and middle-class guests. Despite this it was great for our 1st time there!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThankxgivingTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2-night stay. Everything was "yes" here. We were greeted warmly and enthusiastically, allowed to check in a bit early, were told yes when we thought we wanted a late checkout and the elevator worked well and was fast. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The climate control worked perfectly and the shower was hot. I appreciated the recycling efforts here. The location is great--within 10 blocks of everything you'd want to see and do in Chelsea and within 15 blocks of the New York Public Library, the two major train stations, great shopping, antiquing, etc. Best of all the price was competitive and fair.

Reviews.Title: “LIVING THE DREAM IN N Y C”
Reviews.Author: FalkirkBairn42
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Big Apple and I was a bit nervous how it would all go. (Family of 3 from Scotland, UK...we stay in a small village) I was delighted of our choice of Doubletree Chelsea....and Eva made us feel most welcome. Our request of high floor was honoured...we were on 26th floor and had a good nights sleep. To begin with we did have jet lag that did effect our sleep. I looked out the window and saw a stream of yellow cabs and a view of the Empire State Building. How amazing was that. Yes there are only 2 lifts but we were never really inconvenienced by this. Apparently there are 33000 yellow cabs in N Y. 192 Starbucks in Manhattan. (think that's what the tour guy said) - We saw lots and had lattes in quite a few Starbucks! Although the room was compact...it had 2 double beds, nicely furnished and most important spotless. The beds were sooo comfy. So thanks to your cleaning team. Again the bathroom was very clean and lovely complimentary toiletries. Towels were super clean, white and soft. The staff were always courteous and friendly towards us and you felt they wanted us to be having a good time. Any snacks we had from the restaurant were delicious. French fries, grilled cheese sandwich. We flew from Edinburgh, UK to Newark International. We got the Air-train, then train to Penn Station...was easy walk to hotel. $12:50 each. Train journey took 25 mins. Return journey - Frenz? (I think was his name) was great the bell-hop guy and organised a car for us $80 including tips and tolls. Service was efficient and it took under 30 mins to get to the airport. The traffic was very good, We left 3:30pm on Sunday afternoon. Our flight was at 7:38pm. Well what can I say about New York! - We visited Times Square first thing last Thursday and were too early to pick up our 9am Uptown Bus Tour - We stumbled on the Good Morning America Tv Studio and saw the Desperate Housewives Men on the couch and coming out of the side TV door. My daughter, age 13 was totally star struck. We did the NYC sight seeing tour (3 days for price of 2).......didn't manage to do all the tours but did Uptown, Downtown, Night Tour and ferry to Statue of Liberty. We got off at Ellis Island for history lesson. Ticket also included a visit to Empire State Building and we were so lucky with the beautifal weather. Security checks very tight for ferry and Empire State so will take time...we went early for 8am. The 9/11 memorial was so sad and moving....you can reserve passes on line which are free. Again tight security checks. If you are a' Real Housewives of New York' fan the downtown tour bus does stop off at Zarin Fabrics. Unfortunately we missed our stop....wished we had got off! We were there for 4 nights....just so much to do, so little time. We had breakfast one morning in Amy's bakery, Greenwich Village...very nice.....However please note shops won't open there til 11am....we were too early for Juicy Couture. Shops in Soho were fab and a latte at Dean & Delucca was lovely and lovely ambience. Would I go back to Doubletree Chelsea - Yes absolutely in a hearbeat. We loved the location too. Times Square would be too touristy and busy for us. Well done to you all! Great Customer service and teamwork. Can't wait to return. This is a Scottish saying.....'Back to old clothes and porridge for us' (saying after a holiday) ...Dream over for a wee while! The Risk Family, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: 1265rileyh
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Chelsea was in a great location. We could walk to most everything and if we couldn't the conceirge was more than helpful. Great hotel for a short trip. The rooms are very small but have heard that most hotel rooms in NYC are the same. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mmwrussell
Reviews.Content: This was a great location if you like Whole Foods, Madison Square Garden and Times Square. Times Square is several blocks walk, but not too many. Whole Foods is around the corner and Madison Square Garden only about 2 blocks away. The actual hotel is small and the rooms are also tiny, but they were clean and comfortable. A view toward the statue is great, but not if you're below the 20th floor because most buildings are so tall that you're only seeing other buildings. It was loud at night (I was on the 18th floor), but that's just NY. I could also watch any tv station I wanted because the hotel had a service similar to Xfinity or Uverse. Breakfast in the hotel was great and the servers (Davina and Liz) were a team who knew my order walking in after only one night at the hotel. Overall, great location for me, easier to get to my customer site and great access to cabs whether I went to 7th or 6th Ave. The staff were friendly and helpful and cookies were available whenever you wanted one and not just when you first checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ange33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week. It is right by The Empire State Building and Madison Square Garden. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to Times Square which suited us as we did not want to be right in the centre. Hotel itself is modern. Rooms very clean. Comfortable beds. Staff extremely helpful. Of course don't forget the free cookies which are gorgeous !!

Reviews.Title: “THIS REVIEW IS A LONG TIME COMING - AMAZING ON EVERY LEVEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: PittPoker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Doubletree Hotel since November of last year and let me EMPHATICALLY STATE: Best hotel I have ever stayed in along with the best staff. This Doubletree is like a hidden gem in the heart of New York City. The location is great - near MSG but away from all the noise and although it's a fairly big hotel, I feel like a VIP whenever I speak with any of the employees. The rooms are up to date - modern with a selection of cable channels that any hotel in the U.S would envy - (huge selection of HD channels). The beds are soooooo comfortable with down feather pillows - I get great sleep every night. The restaurant has a nice selection of appetizers, main courses and desserts. I would recommend the salmon(delicious). The servers go out of their way to smile and take care of your needs. Yes, there are only 2 elevators but you know what?? I have NEVER had to wait very long for them and they are fast to the floor requested. Overall, the General Manager has put together a group of hard working and caring employees that separates this hotel from many many others. James(front desk manager) is in my opinion, a caring and excellent manager. Along with the other front desk mgr Will, they answer my every request. I don't want to leave anybody out so I am giving props to every front desk employee I have dealt with: Nicole, Ashley, Eva, Judy. Miguel(Security) is always helpful as well as the house man Israel. Bottom line is this: I don't work for this hotel, I travel a lot and I thank my lucky stars I stumbled upon this GEM of a property. I can't find anything to fault so I am not going to try and think of something. The rates are great, staff is great and amenities are great. What are you waiting for??? See for yourself !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hotelpro18411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NY for Valentine's weekend and got a nice room at this Doubletree for a great rate (under $200)!! We were there for a Broadway show and it was 15 blocks to the theater. It would have been an easy walk but we took a cab each way. Of course the hotel rooms are small but its New York and that is pretty standard.

Reviews.Title: “comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Chelsea when we were in NYC to see the WKC Dog Show. A short 2-block walk from Madison Square Garden, the hotel was clean, comfortable, and convenient. The front desk staff greeted us with friendly smiles and a professional demeanor. Our room on the 20th floor looked out on the Empire State Building. The room was tiny, as is typical of hotel rooms in NYC. The beds were quite comfortable, even though they seemed a little shorter than the average double bed. The room incuded many amenities including coffeemaker, hairdryer, and clock radio w/IPod port. There were only a couple of small negatives- The shower was hot, but not hot enough for me...personal preference. Breakfast is not included. We got a reasonably-priced breakfast of egg sandwiches, juice, and coffee at a little deli at the corner of 29th St. and 6th Avenue. The scones were also delicious. From 2-4 AM, several trucks were very noisily unloaded at the warehouse across from the hotel. The noise was loud enough to keep me awake. You might request a room that faces the rear of the building. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “charming”
Reviews.Author: pledez
Reviews.Content: I found the staff attentive & very pleasant and the price reasonably cheap for NYC. Parking was an additional $22 down the street, if you can, avoid having to use it. Neighborhood was clean for NYC and busy, with cop cars parked down it. The hotel itself was modernly decorated, with soft beds and neat, narrow hallways. The room was quiet. The only tiny problem I had was the bathroom, the water ran brown at first and the bathtub had cracks. Half the towels were soft and half rough. Still I would definitely return next time I'm in NYC. Oh yeah I would definitely not recommend to large groups with kids, the room was pretty small and not much room to run around.

Reviews.Title: “Another decent "sliver" hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: meanchat
Reviews.Content: The lobby is intimate. The front desk staff is nice enough. They were able to supply me with toiletries which I forgot. I had booked through Hotwire at the last minute and I did not notice any lapse in service. They tried to arrange the best room available for me. The warm chocolate chip cookie was also appreciated. The room was small as usual in these type of tall narrow hotels in New York. Everything worked, was clean and I slept well. The room facing the street was quite noisy with the garbage trucks doing their work early in the morning, so earplugs might be a good idea. The parking across the street is convenient and costs $22 with validation from the front desk. The location is convenient and I would stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Grande2305
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Priceline the morning I checked in. Great deal at $75! Checked in early with no problems. Rooms were definitely in the Hilton family. Modern, clean, comfortable and high tech. Wifi did cost 9.95, but so what. Heat worked nicely, but a little loud. Individual wall units. The only negative was the elevator system. There was two elevators for 23 floors. At least one more elevator should be there. Location to the Chelsea sites was great. Also the various options for transportation was within one block. Check out was easy and I am pleased with the choice Priceline made. Wow, a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay June 25 - 27 2010”
Reviews.Author: BellaAurora66
Reviews.Content: Boy, it took me a long time to review - but here it is. We stayed here for our son's 17th birthday trip, to NYC - the first visit for all our children and my husband. We had an easy check-in and our room had a greatl view - and a bit of the Empire State Bldg. However, the room, though very clean and up-to-date, was small - for 5 people. The bathroom was small, and the sink didn't have anywhere to keep all of my items. We could hear all the noise in the hallway and elevator, coming and going. We did not eat in the restaurant or go to the bar - with the kids, it just wasn't possible. With all this said, the area had plenty of choices for eating out, walking distance to ESB and close to the Subway. We never felt uncomfortable walking around; no matter the time of day. Would stay again; but not with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but tiny rooms and hallways.”
Reviews.Author: ctran978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend in September 2011 for the US Open Tennis. The rate was I think about $250 for 2 double beds. This rate was pretty high, but it was a long weekend and people probably booked ahead a while ago. We didn't stay at the hotel that much, but everything was constricted. There is not a huge reception lobby. The bed rooms were tiny and we would always get in eachothers way. The hallways were the same as well. Only one person can pass by at a time. This hotel was really close to Madison Square Garden and only a few blocks away from Times Square. This hotel was also a few blocks away from where the Bolt bus had dropped us off. The cookies we got at check in were awesome though.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt Like it!”
Reviews.Author: LKou
Reviews.Content: 1) Workers at the hotel were drilling a wall at 8.00am. And, since the walls are too thin, can you imagine how nice it was? 2) There arent enough elevators, 2 actually, and stuff uses them also. Not to mention that one of the elevators were out of order twice a day: in the morning and in the afternoon. 3) The room doors are automatic and always make too much noise to be closed. So if you are unlucky as I were, you wonÂ´t be able to sleep, because a huge family took all the rooms in my floor and they move in and out slamming the door. 4) AC device is too much noisy. 5) Dirty place. Cleaning service is not so good. And I mean in the room and at the hall.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, Nothing Special, only Two Elevators so Long Waits”
Reviews.Author: bkcarolina
Reviews.Content: Only two elevators for 26 floors, so be prepared for some long waits. The hotel's fine, nothing special, and the "free" wifi is only in the lobby, so you'll be paying for it if you want it in your room. This is a little deceptive. No other benes, really, so the next few nights I moved a block away to a Fairfield Inn that was nicer, free wifi, free breakfast, larger room.

Reviews.Title: “A few minor things added up to a mediocre stay”
Reviews.Author: Ben R
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Hotwire, at a decent rate of 130/night including taxes and fees for "3.5*" level. So I knew I was getting a decent deal, and expectations were not too high. The receptionist was very nice and there were no surprises getting checked in. The first thing, that set a fairly bad note, was that the hallway on my floor STUNK. Like a bunch of bums were living in the hallway. Also, my room did not have a desk chair. So on our way to dinner, we let the front desk know that they needed to fix these things. They did fix these two problems, mostly. The chair was not an executive style chair they claimed to have, but the smell in the hallway did mercifully abate. Also, note that the smell did not infiltrate our room. The room was actually quite comfortable, clean with pleasing amenities and nice bed. There was even a view of the Empire State Building. There were a number of close by good restaurants in Chelsea. The next day, I decided to work from the room. They refused to let us have 2 chairs in the room, so my partner was relegated to working on the bed. This room is not really big enough for 2 people to work in it, I found out. Further, the internet ($10/day) did not work reliably - it cut out for about 30 minutes on a couple of occasions. Also, the cleaning staff seemed to be using the guest room being cleaned right next to ours as a sort of rest area, and were spending a lot of time going in an out, right next to where we were working. So working in the room was actually rather loud and disrupted through the day. The restaurant downstairs was sufficient to have guests for drinks, but really not a very good place to bring anyone other than a good friend or casual guest. Overall the room and hotel was friendly and generally clean, and convenient to Penn Station. However, it was mediocre considering the various inconvienences we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Richard W
Reviews.Content: We traveled to and from NYC on Megabus from Washington, DC and stayed one night. The hotel was great, especially compared to others in Manhattan I'd read reviews about. It was only about a block from the Megabus drop-off location. We arrived around 1:30PM and didn't expect to be able to check in, but wanted to stash our bags there while we saw some of the city. The front desk clerk, Julian Pearson, was very welcoming and helpful. He checked us in and we were able to go to the room immediately. The room was very nice, comfortable and warm. We expected a small room since it was New York, but it was large enough for our needs and quite cozy. Everything worked well - there was a nice alarm clock, coffee maker (which we didn't use) and hair dryer, plenty of channels on the TV. The towels were thick enough to absorb water, not the thin ones in cheaper hotels. Climate control via the thermostat worked well. I'm a federal govt employee and we used the govt leisure travel rate for a room with 2 double beds (about $143 excluding taxes). Standard rate also is reasonable for NYC, about $168, I believe. We had breakfast there the next day and the waitress was super-friendly and accomodating. Checkout is noon and the hotel was glad to keep our bags until 5:00PM when we had to catch our return bus. Everyone (front desk, bellhop, waitress) was very friendly and helpful. The only (slight) drawbacks were the pillows (no support) and low water pressure (fine for me but ladies washing their hair probably would prefer stronger). Subway (the restaurant) is a few doors down 28th Street and several other restaurants are nearby. All in all a very pleasant experience for our first overnight stay in NYC. I highly recommend this hotel and we're looking forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: DottiesJim
Reviews.Content: I stay here often for business because of it's proximity to Penn Station. It's just a few blocks away so I can check my bags coming and going. I have always enjoyed clean rooms and courteous service.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A_simple_man
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel does not worth it cost. Extra small room. The sink area was so small we could not put our stuff there and had to guggle. Thin walls so you constantly hear the doors in the hallway being shut. Two small elevators for the entrie hotel (including staff) so you always wait (and wait and wait). The location is ok. It's five minutes walk from Penn Station. The only great thing about this hotel was our concierge, Benjamin, who had a great tase for restaurents and was always happy to recommend. He recommended after hearing our taste, and all of his recommendations were right on.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel clean room, did the job for the time we were there.”
Reviews.Author: cassnsyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for new year's. Since we needed 2 rooms the price was right as every other hotel wanted twice as much. The rooms were clean, the staff was very courteous,however if you are looking for a nice sized room this isn't the place. Rooms are small as are the hallways and elevators and lobby. But no funky smells which is always a plus in my book. Didn't really hear any outside noises from the street. The staff was courteous. They even apologized for the extremely slow elevators. We waited about 20 minutes the day we checked out for the elevator. Turned out out of the 2 elevators only 1 was working. We would have taken the stairs however we had a ton of luggage and we were on the 19th floor. The location of the hotel was less than desirable. Wasn't a bad area just a funky area but very close to Penn station which was perfect as we took the train home. The only bad experience we encountered besides the stupid elevators was the room service. Horrible. My daughters stayed in one night and decided to order dinner thru room service. It took nearly 2 hours before they got their food. and when the food finally arrived, part of the order was missing so that took another 20 minutes, the molten lava cake was cold, and the medium rare steak sandwich arrived pretty much raw. So that was not a good experience. Oh one piece of advice...upon checking out double check the rate. for whatever reason the rate was higher upon check out than from when I made my reservation. since i had my original confirmation with the lower rate I was able to get it fixed without any problem.

Reviews.Title: “nne days in Doubletree Hotel Chelsea Ny”
Reviews.Author: julesmoore
Reviews.Content: We were a fam of four , we booked two double beds and we were more than satisfied. We arrived at the hotel at 7 in the morning and they searched for a room that was available at that time!! The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to accomodate us. When we reported we had problems with the tv, in five min the repairman was knocking on our door. Housekeeping personnel were very professional and we left valuables in our rooms and never found anything missing. The doorman went out of his way to hail us a taxi everytime we needed one. I would definitely stay here again, we loved it! Mr. and Mrs. Soto

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: cne24
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay here! Couldn't have been happier with our choice. Check-in was super smooth. Room was small, but to be expected in NYC. We had 2 twin beds and while there wasn't much room to place suitcases, you could move around with no problem (place suitcase in wardrobe or on top of the wardrobe to save room). Nicely appointed, and the beds were comfy. Excellent TV choices if you stay in the room if you choose not to venture out or there are weather issues. Bathroom had great water temp and pressure. Paid for internet (ugh, but what can you do) and it was efficient. No fridge or microwave. We were in our room with 2 small children and the 4 of us were comfy. We had a room on the 22nd floor, and we had a partial view of the Empire State Building, which the kids loved. Parking was almost directly across the street. Fairly convenient, if just a bit confusing. Wish the website would indicate the preferred garage more clearly (I called the desk on the way in to clarify) but no issues at all. Make sure you get the hotel desk to validate your parking slip. Other review says no in/out at the stated rate so confirm that before wanting to retrieve your vehicle during your stay. Hotel convenient to Empire State Building (5 mins), Times Square (about 15 mins), Macy's (10 mins), subway stops. We ate at Waldy's Pizza a street or two away and that was great (check them out). Breakfast buffet was better than expected. Good choices and they'll cook an omelet for you if you request one. The bar was dead at night (at least when we were there) but we did manage to enjoy a few happy hour drinks ($4 wine and beer - a huge difference off the normal prices). But perhaps the best part of the trip - the staff. You can't go wrong here ... we didn't come across one staff member that didn't go out of their way to help or have a smile on their face. Bellman, concierge, front desk, restaurant staff, bartenders ... superb. We've come across friendly staff before but these folks exceeded the norm. Kudos to them for making this family of 4 feel welcome. The worst thing I can say about the Doubletree Chelsea is that the elevator was somewhat slow. We'd look to this property first should we want to stay in the Chelsea area again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Eve in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: rja112
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel was easy to get to ( 2 blocks from the 1 train at 28th street). Bed was comfortable, room was clean and nicely appointed. Only issue in the design was that the shower tended to get the floor wet in the bathroom. Only 2 elevators so at busy times that can be slow. I did have breakfast on Christmas morning, service was good and the Banana Berry Split was a wonderful healthy choice. They do have a concierge who helped me out with some addresses, and the front desk staff was very nice and efficient. If you are a tech addict please be aware that there is a charge for in room WIFI (I don't need to be quite that conected) I made a future reservation for a return visit when I was checking out!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: kar1207
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is small, but efficient. The hotel is clean and the workers are attentive. I have no complaints! The location is also good, close to Penn station. One downside is the restaurant sucks. Though, food options nearby are plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Nice Location, Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: bdevido
Reviews.Content: Was here for three nights during the week in mid December for business. Overall, very nice play to stay. Right in the Chelsea area. Rooms are small (they are small everywhere in NYC) but nicely appointed. Bathroom functional and nice, beds great, elevator is a bit slow at times but nothing major. Great breakfast places right around the corner for coffee, breakfast sandwiches, etc. as noted in below reviews. If you like cigars, there's a great cigar spot on same block just across the street, Martinez Cigars, where they've been making good cigars for 30 years. All in all, I'd recommend highly. I paid $199 per night booking through the hotel's website. Pretty good deal two weeks before Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: d12345_11
Reviews.Content: Great room with an awe-inspiring view of the Empire State Building. I travel in Japan a bit, so I'm used to the "boutique-scaled" rooms -- no big deal with me; I love it and it was very clean. Had a good breakfast in the dining room, too. Even though my trip was back in a bleak and wet September, may I put in a belated thanks to Benjamin, the concierge? What a polite, friendly, thoughtful and knowledgeable young man! He really added much to our stay in NYC. We wish your entire staff a joyous holiday season and great new year!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelGirl09
Reviews.Content: Didn't end up spending much time at the hotel but it's in a good location in Chelsea, away from the hustle & bustle of mid-town during Christmas. Staff seemed a bit inept and the TV and safe did not work in our room (in fairness to the hotel, we didn't raise this issue until the last day, but seriously, is no one checking if the TV is working in a chain like the Hilton!?). Breakfast was good and we got an early check-in, which was great. As is typical of NY hotel rooms, the room was tight but the bathroom was a decent, which two girls can really appreciate

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Katamaran000
Reviews.Content: Based on the previous reviews I thought the rooms were going to be like closets...they are not. They are small but perfectly in line with many Manhattan hotel rooms. Someone said they could not walk two at a time between the beds...we had no issue walking between the beds. The rooms are very clean. We got a view of the Empire State building which should more appropriately be called a "partial view" as we had to lean one way and could only see part but it was still nice to see at night. The location is perfect - within walking distance of the subway so you can really get anywhere easily. One of the biggest pluses for this hotel is the staff. The bellman who helped us both days could not have been nicer. Whoever works the bell station during the day (he said he leaves at 3:00) is truly one of the nicest and hard working bellman I have ever encountered and I travel to the city every other week. The front desk personnel were also not just polite but very friendly with good personality. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a good clean room, nice staff, fair price and central location. One last comment, I would chalk the great hotel personnel up to good management - whoever does the hiring has figured out the right profile to hire. Super friendly and hard working without over stepping their bounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and curteous staff”
Reviews.Author: SLJack
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at a hotel near the NY Penn Station as I was catching an early train. Yes, to echo previous reviewers, the room was small - but, folks, this is New York. The room was scrupulously clean and I simply loved the citrus, honey and coriander shampoo and lotion. The location is superb - you can walk all the way downtown (I tend to do a lot of walking when travelling) or you can walk to Central Park. And of course, there's the subway if you don't want to do all that walking. (But you can't see New York on a subway.) The staff was very curteous - as I was heading out at 5.45am the next morning, the front desk guy offered me cookies to go. (Too bad I need to lose weight.) Overall, a great experience and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Eleana T
Reviews.Content: What people have to realize about any hotel in NYC is that it's going to be smaller than normal. The hallways are really tight in this hotel, even compared to the other places I've stayed in the city. Somewhat claustrophobic. The room itself was small, but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was nice and had an ample supply of towels. I was originally nervous because the toilet paper was towards the end, and there was no other roll in the bathroom, but it was located in the drawers in the room as was the hairdryer! The conceirge Benjamin was extrememly helpful and polite and down to earth - which is appreciated. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we did not try that.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with somewhat small rooms”
Reviews.Author: viking005
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. The hotel is located in a good area, it is close to subway stations and the Empire State Building is in its immediate neighborhood. The room was nice and clean, although somewhat smaller than you would expect. Not only the rooms but the entire hotel is very compact, and only two elevators are available for the very high building. In the busy morning hours this can result in some waiting time. Alternatively, the staircase is available. In general, I would recommend this hotel for a short stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Very small/tight but clean and comfortable bedding-3 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: kross22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a two bed double room (room 404) over the Thanksgiving weekend on a last minute trip with an adult family member and small child. The room was clean (no bed bugs) with modern appointments and the beds and bedding very comfortable but space extremely tight--as in we had to stand between the beds to pass each other. There was also no built in closet just a small wardrobe for us to share. I travel often and this was the smallest room I've ever stayed in except in Europe. I think the single king/queen rooms may be a smidge larger--but I was informed by the staff that all rooms are pretty cramped. We stayed on a smoking floor (none of us smokes) but not bothersome. The hotel however is in a convenient location (on a quiet street) for getting to main attractions--we took all modes of public transportation which were not more than a block or two from the hotel and we felt safe walking the neighborhood at all times of the day/night. I drove up and was also able to park for free on the street across from the hotel for the entire weekend (I arrived after 6 p.m. on a Fri) --it reverts back to commercial only parking at 8 am on Monday at which time I moved my car. I did not check out breakfast but it is at least there for $19.95, less for kids. There is a also a decent enough looking bar (did not use) that will give you ice for your icebucket. Staff was polite and professional. Hotel is also pet friendly for a reasonable fee. No views from my level but hotel has over 24 floors so ask if that is important to you. I thought it was a good value overall ( booked on Expedia) and I think I would stay again if I found a good deal--and could request a larger room. My review is really more like 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of It All!”
Reviews.Author: londonreviewer_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the DoubleTree Hotel Chelsea with a friend January 2011 for a total of 5 nights. After a particularly long journey from London to JFK and then another long cab ride from JFK to DoubleTree Chelsea, I was sincerely hoping this hotel lived up to my expectations. As a very loyal Hilton brand customer, I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. Firstly, the good points: 1.) Location - right in the heart of Manhattan, although advertised as "Chelsea", it felt more like Koreatown when you look at the neighbouring businesses. Saying that, I still felt safe walking alone there at night, and its minutes away from a subway station that will whisk you anywhere. 2.) The Views - Our room had a view of the Empire State Building and the rooftops of lower Manhattan, seriously impressive even for a second time NYC visitor. 3.) THE BAR - It's true that America runs on good service, and in the Doubltree Hotel Chelsea, this is no exception. An all round good service from the staff there (I can only hope the young man that served me over the course of the few nights still works there, he was a credit to the Doubltree brand and well deserved his nice tip we left him when leaving from our stay). Great place to just relax, talk to fellow guests and watch some games on the TV. 4.) Our room - clean, spacious (even for NYC standards), with very, very, very comfortable beds guaranteeing a good nights sleep. Toiletries restocked daily as they should be, room cleaned and bathroom was always immaculate. Great TV to pass a few hours in the morning getting ready to go out. 5.) Gym and Business Centre - perfect for an early morning catch up with Facebook and emails, and a quick jog on the treadmill to wake up your day. Clean and odorless. Now, just a few negatives: 1.) Noise - being in the location its in, even with a high floor room, we never managed to escape the nighttime noise of Manhattan with sirens at all hours - not a fault of the hotel, but should be considered if you are staying here and are a light sleeper as my companion found out. 2.) Our second night of the stay was slightly jarred by an unannounced knock on the door at 3am with a delivery of "additional coffee supplies" we had apparently ordered - the front desk staff admitted their mistake upon talking to them about it at 9am, and prompty apologised and issued us with two free breakfast vouchers. So well done management for sorting that out and providing good customer service. Minus the small negative points, all in all a very pleasing stay at a lovely hotel - I will be back in a few months upon my next trip to NYC (March 2012) and cannot wait to return. Thoroughly recommended for a good value, attentive and great locationed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “squished but comfy, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: wetakethekids
Reviews.Content: went to new york at the last minute and booked a room here for $200 tax included for a family of 4. wanted to be in chelsea. hotel staff was really nice, got us checked in quickly. room had just been readied (we checked in at 3). got a sliver of a view of the empire state building on the 26th floor!). room is as compact as you can be with 2 double beds, a small closet and chest but is was what we expected. we've stayed at the residence inn near bryant park, embassy suites near battery park, and affinia dumont - all suites and more roomy, but this was fine. one block from the 123 red line and very easy walk to times square/rockefeller. we found weekend on street parking in about 1/2 hour of trolling around and saved the 22/day parking fee! cookies a nice touch, getting extra shampoo and tv fixed were done promptly and nicely. we aren't picky about our ny digs, this was perfectly nice and we'd stay again if the price and location were right for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EricC01
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very small and expensive.... However, in New York you have to accept small and expensive. My room on the 26th floor had excellent views looking towards Lower Manhattan. The room was tiny - but I didn't intend to spend much time there, the only time there was spent sleeping and the beds were the most comfy I've slept in! The batroom was small but served its purpose with excellent ammeneties. The location was excellent - between 6th and 7th on 29th, just a couple of minutes walk to Penn Station and a few more to Times Square. My only problem was dealt with extremely efficently... arriving back at the hotel for a quick recharge before a meal and the theatre... a group of 40 French guests arrived... and with only 2 small elevators we were getting nowhere fast! We were directed to the lower ground level where an elevator was waiting to bypass the lobby and whisk us to our room!

Reviews.Title: “Covenient, Comfortable, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Toad143
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this Doubletree in Chelsea. Front desk staff was superb especially Ashley who provided excellent service. Less than a mile from the Javits, Great restaurants within walking distance. Hotel is between 6th and 7th on 29th Street. I was there for the three nights. Room was small but nicely furnished. Nice large LCD TV. Comfy bed with lots of pillows. Fresh & Co. just around the corner, great place for breakfast and lunch on the go. I walked back and forth to Javits several times with ease. Halls and lobby are tight but everything was clean and every staff member that I met was pleasent. I would stay here again. For the price I think it is one of the best values in NYC. Ask for a street side room. Safe Travels! .......By the way, the Bed bug comment can not be correct. It takes days for a bed bug bite to appear. He might have gotten bit by something else. I have learned to check everytime I visit a hotel. I saw no evidence.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at a different Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Anarusso01
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite for my family,reading the reviews everyone said that it was small, but I figured it couldn't be that bad, they were right! Two people cannot walk in the room at the same time. The elevators can not accomadate the high volume of people using them. Even the staff with their carts use them. The wait is unacceptable. They charged my card a few times by mistake, which was a nusence dealing with my bank! Way too expensive! Not worth staying there! You will get more for your money by staying at the Doubletree suites in times square!

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: sftraveling1
Reviews.Content: Judy is awesome! I had a bad experience around the corner at the Hilton Garden so I decided to move to Double tree. I was greated by Judy at the fronk desk and saw the difference a warm greeting can make. I checked out of HGI because the staff was abrasive. The rooms are a decent size and there are those a/c units mounted in the wall under the window that makes regulating the temp difficult. The prices are very reasonable and the rooms are very clean which made up for the slightly chilly night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A good night's stay”
Reviews.Author: Frequentraveler_724
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of noghts in Manhattan on business and have been in hotels of sll ranks. When I am staying in Chelsa this is one of my favorites and I actually now look for it because it is a very plesant stay. Yes the rooms are small but they are comfortable and the lighting is ok. (Lots of hotels seems to be leaving out the lights these days.) The beds are super comfortable in this hotel which is a bibg plus for me. The staff also goes out of their way to try and be plesant and helpful. ALways responsive to requests. The immediate neightborhood is not the fanciest but if you look around and are willing to walk a bit or get in a cab there are good restaurants within a reasonable distance. The actual street the hotel is not is not much for the way of anything that you would ever want to go to for food, shopping, etc. But you are right between 6th and 7th avenues and there more there. The elevators are not super fast. So a personal tip is I try to get mid-rise floor so I am above street noise and high enough to be able to get into the elevators during the morning rush. There are only two and they are slower. What's best about the hotel is the price. I shop around for good prices and good places and this hotel is always on the list of places I look. Sometimes the price shoots way up and I will shop around for another place -- this coming week I am staying a few blocks away at a competitor because the price was $100 cheeper but on my prior stay it was the Double Tree that was $50 less than anything else I found. The desk, work space is good too and a nice big TV. That;s about it for the room though. So if you are looking to spread out or settle in a big comfy chair look elsewhere. But if you want a clean room, helpful staff, comfortable bed, and a price that is about the best in Manhattan check this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Bite - Ouch!”
Reviews.Author: christina l
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of a three star hotel in NYC. Small but comfortable rooms, limited services. The front desk and concierge staff were good. The location is extremely convenient for many NYC attractions and subway access to all parts of the city. My one complaint -- and its a big one -- I was bitten by a bed bug. When I called to request a room change the front desk was extremely accomodating but interestingly didn't ask the reason for my request (this made me very suspicious). I volunteered that I had been bitten by "something" but they didn't comment except to say they would check the room. Bed bugs are a well documented problem in NYC. Before booking this hotel I checked the bed bug registries and the Doubletree was not listed. It is now.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Pleasant Room, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: RSStone
Reviews.Content: Got this room in the heart of Manhattan for a great price ($125+ tax and fees) using Priceline "name your price." Doesn't quite have the amenities to be a 3-star hotel, but the room was nice (small, but nice), the bed comfy, and the staff excellent. Best part of the room: The view!! Unobscured cIty skyline from the upper floors at night. Location is within walking distance of Bryant Park and Theatre District (11 blocks). I would stay there again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good Option for NYC”
Reviews.Author: petitebrioche
Reviews.Content: Location is good. The Empire State Views are not worth the upgrade - go for a suite. Rooms are SMALL as you would expect from a NYC hotel- really Small. Very Clean. 1 Suit Case in these rooms is enough! My friends stayed for a week - 2 adults 2 Children... they survived three days in a room with two doubles - but they had to move to a suite... they were not enjoying there holiday - I suggested they upgrade ... they did and there life and holiday became a much better place! If your traveling Solo or with someone you want to be very close to the Doubletree Chelsea is a good choice. Friendly, Clean, Comfortable...

Reviews.Title: “the perfect weekend...”
Reviews.Author: julie b
Reviews.Content: Very good emplacement in quiet area but very close to action,5 mins. walk to time square,15 mins. walk to chelsea market. confortable bed and clean room. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: rdb61
Reviews.Content: We were in town on vacation. The staff is fantastic. Very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are fine and the hotel location is perfect for getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Lori_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree and loved it. It was off the beaten path but very, very safe and within walking distance of Times Square, Macy's. In our package we had a buffet breakfast which was great. Rooms were small but we were hardly there anyways. Very, very clean and staff were incredibly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good location”
Reviews.Author: DaveMoutrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a business trip and needed to be able to get around to various meetings on Manhattan and overt in Brooklyn. The location worked well as the transport links were good. The rooms were comfortable, very clean and an OK size but not spacious and very good bed and shower. Great coffee maker in the room but wireless internet access in your room is expensive at $9.95 a day. However, free wireless is available in the foyer. The staff were great, helpful and friendly. The sound insulation to the rooms from the corridor is not great so if you have noisey neighbours coming back late expect to be disturbed. Breakfast was good and comparable to what you would pay in a dinner. Good to have a space to sit outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Always a welcome place with friendly people!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions for business trips. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff is super-friendly. You are always greeted with smiles but an attentive staff, at the door, front desk, and at breakfast. I would definitely stay again!! The only downside is the same as many newer NYC hotels-it can take a longer time to get an elevator on weekday mornings around 8 or so as there are three elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Guestess
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the 23rd floor and the room had a partial view of the Empire State Building. The room was tight but it had a coffee-maker! So many NYC hotels lack that feature. The shower was great; lots of hot water and decent pressure. The room was clean and bed linens really fresh. As far a the location is concerned, Chelsea isn't your most up-scale location but it is surely central. It wasn't hard to walk to the Village or over to Grand Central. Rather than stop for breakfast, the Doubletree chocolate chip cookies fit the bill nicely. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the location and the Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: alepublicity
Reviews.Content: Fanny the concierge was fantastic! She Found us the best place to celebrate our anniversary! Thank you Fanny! The room was very small but the location and staff were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good value”
Reviews.Author: RobbertOhio
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the doubletree one night for business in new york. The hotel is simple, centrally located, and good value for the city. I could walk to my meeting the next morning. The rooms are compact but complete. I had to call the reception to turn down the airco which was on at full power, as i could not figure out how to turn it down by myself. After calling reception, someone from the hotel came promptly to help. Breakfast is good and a la carte with good service. Wireless works. Tip: turn left outside of the hotel, walk 2 blocks and try Uncle Nicks restaurant. A Greek restaurant that is very authentic. All in all, i will probbly go back to the Doubletree...and uncle Nicks...!

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel, dirty location, can find better in NYC”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLive
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in dirty street, lifts are very slow, foyer was very small, not what I would have expected from a Hilton. When I got there the wireless internet wasnt working which is critical for business travel. Cancelled my booking and moved different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: christianolivier01
Reviews.Content: First hotel in Manhattan and i really enjoyed ! 2 minutes walk to Madison square Garden and 15 minutes walk from Times Square. Desk is really helpful and the room was perfect. The bad thing about this hotel is that there is only 2 elevators for 27 floors.

Reviews.Title: “A good one!”
Reviews.Author: wise_lily
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Chelsea, away of crowds. Convenient access to subways. Nice terrasse where we had free wi-fi access. Small and clean rooms. Comfy beds. Very helpful staff. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: Daniel025
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at the Chelsea Doubletree during a fantastic weekend in New York City. The hotel is located in 29th street between 6th and 7th avenue. Even though it is situated close to Penn Station an quite close to Times Square, the street is very, very quiet. We slept in a nice room in the 4th floor, close to the elevator. In comparison to other "budget concious" options in NYC, the room was big enough for a good night's sleep and its soundproof was great, as we did not hear any noise, neither form the street or the elevator. The bathroom was clean and also big enough. The only minor issue was that the closet was on the small side, what can be a problem if you stay there for a longer period. Front desk staff was very nice and helpful, when we arrived we were offered two very good chocolate cookies as well as free wi-fi. Our rate was quite expensive, but I only booked 4 days in advance. Hilton has other properties nearby (Garden Hilton, Hampton Inn), but we would definitively recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest hotel room I have ever stayed in but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: buttercup16
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Doubletree in Chelsea in September. I chose the hotel because of the location which is near my daughter's apartment and the price. It happens to be close to Penn station which is convenient as well if you are coming in on the train. Overall, it was a solid hotel. The lobby was plain and small but check in was easy. The elevator was slow. The room was clean and the bed linens were great. The bed was comfortable. However, the room was the smallest I have ever stayed in. There was hardly room to walk around the beds and you couldn't walk around the beds if someone was occupying the desk chair. The bathroom was small as well but adequate. There was little or no view out the window and I didn't love the street scene on the block but it was safe. One other slight criticism, when my daughter asked the concierge for recommendations for a Korean barbecue restaurant close by, the concierge looked perplexed and said they had never been asked that before. As it turned out we were not three blocks from the probably one of the most, if not the most, concentrated areas of Korean barbecue restaurants in the United States. It's not like we were in North Carolina asking for a Korean restaurant. All in all, it was a nice and clean hotel but tiny and no wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, but adequate for visiting New York City”
Reviews.Author: Vahndulife
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for small rooms and corridors, but remember this is New York City, where space is at a premium. The front desk staff is friendly and the warm, gooey chocolate chip cookies that everyone raves over should be eaten immediately! They aren't that great when they are room temperature, which is a mistake I made in eating them later. I was upgraded to floor 26 with a complimentary breakfast voucher and a bar discount. Breakfast is okay - the usual hot and cold items. The gym is underground and the approach is through a narrow corridor from the reception area, but the gym itself is a decent size. The TV remote is unnecessarily complex - it controls the Cable TV box hidden below the TV and not the TV itself. Make sure you point it at the cable box to change anything on the TV. The room was small but clean. The King bed seemed short and I ended up sleeping diagonaly to keep my feet inside the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: EscapeChick
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, a H Honors member, cashed in credit card miles to book this room for a girls night out. We were pleasantly greeted at the front desk with warm, gooey chocolate chip cookies that were delicious. We were upgraded to floor 26 (27 is the highest) which was nice with two complimentary breakfast vouchers. The room was small but clean. I had some trouble figuring out how to hook up my mp3 player and called the front desk. The front desk advised they would contact a technician. A technician immediately called me back (within 2 minutes). I received a follow up call from the front desk asking if the technician followed up. Wow, that was a surprise. The only complaint was that both double beds were short. My legs were hanging off the end, really weird. I think the beds must have been custom made to fit this small room. Breakfast was just ok, nothing special. Coffee was quite terrible though. Check out was a breeze and the front desk staff was super friendly. They even gave us fresh cookies at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Better than your average NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: DistrictScott
Reviews.Content: I am always fearful of staying in NYC hotels with their tiny rooms and absence of quality service. However, I was pleasantly surprised that the guest rooms at this hotel, although small, were laid out to best maximize the space. I never felt cramped. Guest services were great, and the TV channel selections were by far better than any hotel I've stayed at before (although many visitors aren't in NYC to watch TV). The elevators were slow to arrive at times, but that's expected with high floor hotels in NYC. Although the area around the hotel was fairly nondescript, the location itself was great, with easy access to great shopping and several convenient subway stops.

Reviews.Title: “Room was robbed, HOTEL DID NOTHING ABOUT IT”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed at the Doubletree Chelsea (NYC) For Business on 9/13/11. She came back to her room to find her $4000 Mac Cpu, as well as her wallet, credit cards, hundreds in cash, checkbook, and prescriptions had all been stolen. Upon calling the police, and notifying hotel mgmt., the Doubletree Corporate offices customer service, the mgr. said there was nothing the hotel could/would do, that is was a police matter now. They would not even comp her room. UNBELIEVABLE. THIS WAS CLEARLY AN INSIDE JOB. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS.

Reviews.Title: “Better than fancier hotels!”
Reviews.Author: WNPK
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Doubletree Hotel in Chelsea, on 29th between 6th & 7th. The area around the hotel is fairly nondescript and full of wholesale markets, but the hotel itself is great. The location is near the red, orange and yellow subway lines, and is walking distance to the 4,5,6 trains. It's also quieter than hotels in more bustling areas. The lobby is tiny, but the rooms are decent for NYC hotels (which generally means they are smaller than hotels in other cities). We had a very comfortable king-sized bed in our room and a full, ensuite bath. The air conditioning worked perfectly! The housekeeping service was great and the amenities were very thoughtful and complete -- toiletries, iron and board, hair dryer, coffee maker, WiFi, and plug points in all of the places where you would most likely use them! The staff was great, and the concierge was very helpful booking a car service to JFK when we were leaving. We also were able to leave our luggage at the hotel the day of our departure so we could roam about until the evening. Overall, super comfortable place to stay in NYC for a decent price ($129/night). Plus the cookies from the front desk were yummy!

Reviews.Title: “nice place for quick trip”
Reviews.Author: frieda-f
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Was just here for a quick overnight and didn't really get a chance to explore the neighborhood due to heavy rain, but not a lot seemed to be going on in the immediate area. But good for a business trip in the rain where we cabbed everywhere anyway. Rooms were small, but very clean and the hotel was really quiet. Comfy beds, nice shower and I love that warm cookie you get at check-in. In-room continental breakfast was sufficient but pretty pricy ($38 for two people). I would stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For The Area”
Reviews.Author: traderDenver
Reviews.Content: Small room, 2 beds. But for $200 per night instead of $400, it was a good deal relatively speaking. The neighborhood is not great; it's on a side street where there was some litter, but not that bad. Location was very convenient to all locations in Manhattan. Maid service was ok, it was clean, but had trouble getting enough towels. Got a good sleep, room was small but functional and bed was a bit soft but still ok. Overall, if you are trying to conserve cash, this is a very reasonable choice. You can spend a lot less and get a lot less, or spend a lot more and get a bit more, or spend a whole lot more to get a lot more. That's New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: j p
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel partly based upon the excellent ratings noted on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. Customer service was excellent. From booking our reservation directly, to their reasonable dealings with us related to the recent hurricaine which arrived during our stay, to their going the extra mile to ship to us an item left behind in a room. Outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: The location is exellent. On a side street, but in the middle of the action. Within walking distance of the theater district, or just a couple of blocks away from subway station. The rooms were on the small side but very comfortable and functional. And what they say about doubletree beds is truth! they are amazing!! The free internet worked very good. The lifts were ok, there were just two of them and quite busy but nothing too annoying. The maids were lovely and very helpful and cleaned the room throughly every day. I would stay here again over and over and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Return”
Reviews.Author: charli3601
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, although the rooms are small and the bathrooms tiny. This is NYC but even small for NYC. Easy walk to multiple subway stations and attractions. Elevators are painfully slow when the hotel is crowded, so I am giving it a three.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel with a good conceirge service”
Reviews.Author: Iwshere
Reviews.Content: Was 5 minutes away from Path Station. Had choosen the location as my office was in Hoboken. Otherwise not too great by location. Empire state was few blocks away. the worst thing was the nil sleep quality. The rooms are small and very close to each other. One keeps on feeling that someone is entering your room even if they are going to their room or opening their almirah. Overall at the max should stay for 1 day and that too if it is near to your office. Not too fit for family stay

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff, the rest OK”
Reviews.Author: Artemus_Gordon
Reviews.Content: Found the staff to be very pleasant. The hotel is newer, but doesn't feel new. Small lobby. Decor in lobby and halls are dragged down by beige industrial type steel doors more suitable for a parking garage. A tall skinny building with very narrow corridors. 25 floors/2 small elevators. Yes, you will wait. Rooms are fine by New York standards; not big, but adequate size. Internet service was faster than in most hotels. In a more gritty part of Chelsea with numerous cheap handbag and junk jewerlry stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel with two star bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Dorfer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at the Hilton Doubletree Hotel Chelsea before taking Amtrak to Boston. We usually stay at Marriott or Starwood hotels, however I recently received Hilton Gold status as a promotion and figured we'd try this hotel. The hotel was also within walking distance to Penn Station and the AAA price was pretty good. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. It's located around the corner from Penn Station and within walking distance to a lot of great sights and restaurants. Overall, the hotel has a nice appearance with outside seating in front, small lobby, etc. Check-in was quick and easy and our room was okay. It was a "suite" with separate sitting area and bedroom. My main complaint was with the super small bathroom. I can handle the small size, however after getting into the shower, I realized the shower curtain liner was missing. Of course, this got the entire bathroom soaking wet. I also found the faucet on the sink was broken and required two hands to turn the water on and off. I called room service and they eventually brought me a new shower liner. Overall, this hotel is in a great location, but needs to improve their room maintenance and cleaning procedures to ensure everything is ready before guests check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Wjumaal
Reviews.Content: Room was small but come on it's new york. Nice helpful staff upon check in. Didn't spend much time in room traveling throughout the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: ChuckandJack
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Chelsea is conveniently located near subway access. Just a short walk from Penn Station makes it easy to get anywhere in the area. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I requested additional coffee from the maid but she only had decaf. This was fine with me but later that evening when I returned to the hotel she had left a small bag on my door with regular coffee. It is small gestures like this that make a good stay a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtravel
Reviews.Content: Newer hotel in the slowly fading 'plant district'. Lived in NYC so room size was plenty ample- location notcan issue (near homeless soup kitchen on 31st St.) Frannie, the concierge, is the best! Easy to get around the city. Mostly tourists at this hotel. Decent business center and cardio area on lower level.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Price, Friendly Front staff”
Reviews.Author: Whitney C
Reviews.Content: I saw a couple reviews that said the neighbor was 'dicey' or scary. I have to say as a group of woman/girls traveling alone, we did not feel unsafe at all, even when we returned to the hotel fairly late one night. The front desk staff (William) was very friendly and helpful on check in and check out. The parking garage is close and very convenient. The only issue I had while staying there was that they upgraded us to a Junior Suite. We didn't really think of it at the time until we got to the room but they must have thought 2 children, 2 adults meant a couple were staying in the room. This wasn't the case, it was my same sexed friend and her child and myself and my child. So I had to sleep on the pull out couch with my daughter and gave my friend the bed. Not a huge deal, the pull out was not that uncomfortable. However, they did not have the bedding in the room and I had to call for it. It was about 11pm at night, we were ready for bed and it took almost 30 minutes for them to bring it up (they had to come twice, brought only towels the first time) and then we were only given sheets. Luckily we travel with pillows and blankets and made it work. I think they would have been accommodating if given the chance but it was still a pain to have to wait that long when I was ready for bed. Also, once the sleeper sofa is pulled out, the room is extremely small as the big coffee table is then in the way. I would definitely stay there again though :)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, new rooms - IÂ´ll be back”
Reviews.Author: rolandfiege
Reviews.Content: Best breakfast service, always friendly with an extra smile - and they will have an espresso machine soon to fulfill the caffeine loverÂ´s dreams :-) The rooms are a quite small, but everything is almost new and very clean. The advantage of a big hotel chain (you know what you get) with a personal service. Recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel, Location is good, Hospitality second to none.”
Reviews.Author: Mattcooper91
Reviews.Content: Brilliant 4 nights here, would recomened. Location is about 15minutes walk to times square 5 minutes to Madison, 10 to Empire state. Pleasent and Helpful staff. Nice modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; neigborhood a tad dicey”
Reviews.Author: CTKerryd
