Reviews.Content: This property offers terrific value and service. The price is right, the staff friendly and hospitable. The rooms are clean & up to date (if a bit on the small side; not a problem for most recreational visitors in New York). The AC was awesome; we like a cold room at night and NYC temperatures were over 100 degrees F during our stay. Wifi was free and problem free. One thing Doubletree does well is offer free breakfast (which was quite good). They will even let you forgo the buffet and cook an omelet for you. More important to me, as an early riser, they provided free coffee (upon request & with a voucher) in to-go cups so I could read the (free!) paper in the comfort of my room. Why is it that mid-priced hotels provided these nice perks but higher-line properties (at least in NYC) force me to search for coffee and paper every morning? Go figure. The immediate neighborhood left a little to be desired. There was a homeless man sleeping on the sidewalk next door to the hotel and 29th St. is a little dark at night, with little foot traffic.This left my wife feeling a little uneasy, however we were with another couple and did not feel threatened (safety in numbers). We spend 2 or 3 weekends per year in the city and I prefer neigborhoods with more activity in them, from both an entertainment and security point of view. Access to subways is OK, however East side subway service generally means more transfers to other parts of the city. We used cabs more that we usually do.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: BAM-B
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed here for the weekend, in order to help my daughter get settled in NYC for her new job. The hotel is a great location for many of the walking sights in the city...Central Park, Times Square, Theatre District,etc.. It was also near the subway, which is important. The street was a bit dark late at night, but I was not concerned about safety,as there was a group of us walking. The workers were very kind and helpful, making you feel welcome and being knowledgeable about the city and surroundings. It has parking just across the street for $22.00 a day ( a necessity for us,as we drove in from Ohio bringing items for our daughter's move). We did not use the car for the entire stay of 3 days. The room was not exceptionally spacious, but you are in NYC and it was what we had expected. Our room had a good view of the Empire State Bldg. and it was very clean. The beds were very comfortable! The breakfast (included in our rate) was very good, as you could order a number of hot dishes from the kitchen, as well as, eat from the buffet. This hotel was a good value in NYC, where prices can be out-of-this-world!!! Worth the money. We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It's standard fayre”
Reviews.Author: andersaxson
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel is okay, I think I chose it becuase it was relatively inexpensive (I am also HH Gold (room upgrade, internet, breakfast etc) and I was just putting my head down for the night. DOn't expect anything too special, and, again, I feel like I'd have been better off in a new Garden Inn than a not too exciting Double Tree. The rooms here are, of course, a bit pokey (I got a room with a little sitting room, so was actually okay) but this place feels a bit uninspired. The breakfast was also not that great. On the plus it was clean, very nice staff (which is always important to me) and I have no overall complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: VMAW
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed, decent hotel although only 2 lifts which took ages to arrive during a busy time of day which was slightly annoying. Bit of a strange area of NY but I am told it is on the way up! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Accidental find on this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsview11
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Priceline so I never would have tried it otherwise. I was blown away by how great it was. Its a new property, the service and check-in was great, I even got two cookies, mmmmm, cookies. The room I was given was small which is typical for New York but it had a great view of the Empire State Building, flat screen TV, one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in, granite sink counter top in the bathroom, good shower, great Crabtree & Evelyn bathroom amenities. I'll go out of my way to try and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Close to Subways! Clean with Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night while attending a Yankees game (Got to see Jeter get his 3000th hit!). It was easy to access the D train to the Bronx (Yankee Stadium). The hotel is a short walk to Penn Station (34th Street) which has multiple subway lines. The neighborhood was nice with places to eat with in a few blocks. We arrived early and were welcomed by friendly staff, who held our bag for us while we traveled about the city. We were also greeted with warm cookies upon check in. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely stay here again when we visit NY over night.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Nayla1323
Reviews.Content: I went to New York for a one week trip and stayed in this hotel for about 2-3 days...Its outstanding..I will surely come back to this hotel!! The sheets were clean, luxurious bathrooms and the staff was very nice..I asked them for a room on top floor and they gave it to us! The only thing the hotel could improve on is Room Service...I did not eat food there (I ate some other place) but the restaurants looked great! I didn't want to get out of bed when I slept there! I would recommend this hotel to a lot of people...This is an awesome hotel in New York City!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Doubletree - A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: chgocutie
Reviews.Content: From the moment I ran across the Doubletree Chelsea on the internet, I knew that it would be a good find. And I was correct. From the moment I arrived, the staff was courteous and very helpful. They greeted me and my friend at the front desk and couldn't have been more friendly. We arrived a little early and they had a room ready without delay. They gave us a few of their famous Doubletree cookies and offered assistance with our baggage. We were in a room on the 16th floor, right across from the elevator. The room was an average size for New York, but had a very comfortable bed (it was heavenly) and strong water pressure in the shower, which by the way, had a massager. We had a view of the Empire State Building, and it was wonderful! The fitness center, located in the basement of the hotel, was small, yet functional. There were a small number of treadmills, an elliptical machine, and a small weight bench with free weights. The hotel itself is located approximately 1 1/4 blocks from the 1 line at 28th Street. The area is pretty quiet at night, and we didn't feel unsafe walking around. Taxi cabs are a very frequent occurrence in New York, if walking to the subway is not an option. Parking, if you bring a vehicle, is only $22 per night and the garage is right across the street. A word on parking, the pedestrian entrance to the garage is across the street and around the corner. The only issue I had with this location was that the housekeeping staff took our dirty towels and didn't replace them, and the hotel night staff didn't replace them after THREE requests to do so. The front desk management team rectified the situation the very next morning. All in all this is a great hotel in a great location, and I will stay here again. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not like a chain, chain, chain - and you'd be a fool not to try it!”
Reviews.Author: cootmom
Reviews.Content: When traveling solo I stay at boutique hotels and avoid the chains, especially in NYC. I like to stay in a different hotel every visit. For this trip we needed two beds and almost none of the boutiques have them as their rooms are way too small. The Doubletree has a perfect location and a charming staff. The rooms are very clean, bedding comfortable, great shower. There is a very charming outside front patio for people watching and enjoying drinks or a late night snack. Only one minor complaint is two ve-r-r-y slow elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: gauchojoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NYC for one week at the Doubletree in Chelsea. The room, as expected, is a small, tight room that challenged us to settle into for a one week stay. Drawer space is limited, Internet is charged, however, you can go down to the lobby and get free WiFi there. The Food and Beverage Staff were outstanding. We had purchased breakfast for every morning and were very happy with our decision. Liz and Davina were awesome. After the first day, they knew what we liked and serviced us beautifuly. They were very friendly and provided us tips for the day. Our boys loved the special orders and attention. Definitely a 10 out of 10 to this crew. Our bell hop, Frank, was very friendly, and welcomed us every time we got back from our NYC adventures. He always greeted us in the AM and sent us off with good wishes. There is something to be said for a bell hop that makes you feel like home when your away from home. Frank was great. From time to time we got tips from our Concierge, Christian. He gave us great tips and arranged a few things for us. He did not steer us wrong, and his tips, directions, et al were spot on. Yes, we knew the names of the workers at the Doubletree in Chelsea. We never learn the names of the staff in our stays, but this was different. The staff was great top to bottom, from check-in to check-out. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to the NYC. The red-line subway is a 5 minute walk away. You can walk to Time Square in about 10-15 minutes. The Empire State Building is about a 10 minute walk away. It is a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, great value”
Reviews.Author: greenidlady
Reviews.Content: When we booked this room last minute for Sunday night the customer service agent worked very hard at finding us a room in NYC. She was able to find us a room at the Chelsea location that would accommodate my dog for a very reasonable rate. When we arrived the staff was very friendly. The room is not huge but for 120 a night we did not expect a 500 sqaure foot room. It was big enough for us and the bed was very cozy. We were always spoke to when coming in and out of the hotel and someone always hailed a taxi for us. We decided to order room service for breakfast which was also subperb.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: bostongolfers
Reviews.Content: This is an understated hotel with quiet rooms and while not pretending to be anything other than a good value and comfortable place to stay, it really does everything a hotel costing far more can do.Clean rooms, modern and decent resturant in the hotel. Very central to everything Chelsea. Good place to go if you have a weekend at the theater or a sports event at the Garden. Easy walk to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chelsea choice”
Reviews.Author: Sparkybutts
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly for an NYC hotel, I have no complaints whatsoever. Stayed in a small ish room with a king bed which was fine and spacious enough. Perfect location close to the subway and just a walk away from times sq. Would definitely stay again. Should probably mention that I chose it off the back of an Expedia promotion so it probably felt better value because of that. In any case, the rooms are modern and very clean: rare for midtown.

Reviews.Title: “So well taken care of....and late at night too!”
Reviews.Author: QueenoftheSlipstream
Reviews.Content: My 22 year old daughter was moving to Manhattan, and I was helping her move her piles of luggage there from California! We were flying on passes, so had no idea when/what day we'd actually arrive, therefore, did not make hotel reservations in advance. We arrived late (after 11 pm) and I got on Trip Advisor and started scouting. Found a great deal at the Doubletree Chelsea, and called them from the airport. A friendly late night desk associate assured us of a spot on the phone, and greeted us warmly as we arrived about 1 am. He helped us with the luggage, and gave us a GREAT room, as well as a suggestion for an open all hours pizza joint. in the morning, we had a complimentary breakfast downstairs -- all in all it was just a GREAT experience. Staff can make or break a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Amy19705
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for just one night - we were in town to see a show and wanted to have breakfast at Chelsea Market in the morning. The hotel was very clean and the beds were super-comfortable. Nice view of the city. We ate at the hotel's restaurant and had an EXCELLENT cheeseburger and salad. Stopped there for drinks again after the show - they were just closing but were accommodating! They give you warm chocolate chip cookies when you check-in and they have the sign-out-by-TV arrangement if you like that. Very nice overall!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Jamieleigh514
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree Chelsea for New Year's Eve weekend. It was very comfortable and clean. The staff provided outstanding service. Location was perfect for walking to Madison Square Garden. Pretty easy to get around the city and a nice quiet location to stay for New Year's Eve weekend. It was nice to be away from the craziness of Times Square. Most comfortable bed ever!!! They told us they really didn't have any rooms with a view, and that was fine for us. We weren't there for the view. Just wanted a clean and comfortable room for the weekend and that's what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Priced Right”
Reviews.Author: SunNSki09
Reviews.Content: The price was right for our family. This is a newly built property with nice comfy beds and flat screen TV. It's location is somewhat out of the way from majot tourist attractions however there are two subway stations within an easy walk. Highly reccomended as the hotel is new and clean. Not a lot of ammenities but if you're on the go who needs all that anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy Place”
Reviews.Author: nessiek30
Reviews.Content: Arrived at The Doubletree on Thursday 27Th May for our five night break, Took my 16 yr old daughter to buy her prom dress and see all the major sites. First impression was very much a travel in/ hoilday express, ( I stay in them regular for work) Was ok nothing flash. We were on the 14th floor, Our veiw was someones bedroom nice! Carpet had stains on the floor but other then that clean and comfy, The only thing I would say was a pain was the aircon way to loud and either freezing or boiling. It was 90 degress when we were there. Reception was pokey and dull and the sofas could do with a clean, we never went to gym just didnt have the time. We never went into restaurant to eat as prices seemed very expensive. When I first arrived I discovered my daughter had left a bag at the airport I asked recpetion if I could call the airport and the first person was very rude and said no I couldnt use the phone! I was most upset I left the hotel for a few hours I was tired and fed up, I tried to use my mobile out there but I just couldnt get threw to lost property at Newark, Came back to the hotel and asked a differnt person and he said yes. Any way didnt get the bag back, nor did lost property return my call. I didnt expect to get the bag back but a call would have been nice. New York city is like London on speed, Its crazy, Funny, and nothing surpries me any more, Beggers with no legs busking, singers, a crazy guy of times sq banging a saucepan lid? Empire state was a 2 hr Q. statue of liberty 2 hr q. Rockafella centre about 45 mins, NBC studio tour sold out 2 days in advance so pre booked, we had the city pass. Ground zero just made us cry. Stardust dinner very good food and singing, just a shame they ask for such big tips. Planet hollywood good grub too, only if you use your city pass to get your $10 dollars off they change 18% tip!. plus did all the shops, best for bargins was forever21 but got some good ones in jcpenny and tj max. wanna go back in winter to see what central park is like then its so well kept. but would proably stay else where. On my return home asked the hotel to book my shuttle bus, they got the date wrong and did it for 24 hrs after my plane took off. I went and asked on the Tuesday for a shuttle bus to be booked for the next day which would mean Wednesday yes? No the lady booked it for Thursday and a time I would have been in the UK! Didnt relaise until i questioned her when bus was 20 mins late. Another bus couldnt be booked so I had to get a taxi and I had to pay the $88 not the last impression I wanted of New York Double Tree Chelsea!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Chelsea.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMogul
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this property in May 2011 while in town for the BookExpo America show. The hotel is conveniently located close to both my office on 5th ave & 27th street, and it's a 20 minute walk from the Javits Center. The design of the hotel is identical to that of the Hilton Garden Inn which is one block south of this property. I found this hotel to be nice and clean. I was greeted by helpful desk staff. I also watched a game in the bar during the evening and found it to be enjoyable and low key. The room I had was new and had a nice view from the 26th floor. It was a room with two double beds do to occupancy rates, I usually get a king. I was not offered an upgrade because the hotel was sold out. I was offered a free hot breakfast in the restaurant, which was served by friendly faces. I will most likely return to this hotel on my future visits to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joy2travelBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel, which I would say is in the Garment District, after a wonderful few days at a great hotel in Boston. This hotel was more expensive and just didn't compare in any way. First impressions matter and we walked up and down the street and couldn't see it - asked at a hotel over the road where it was and it was well hidden by netting - don't know whether it is being cleaned or renovated as on-one mentioned it. This made the foyer area very dark, dingy and uninviting - it's incredibly small anyone so immediate feeling wasn't good. Staff at check in where pleasant, but on getting to our room there wasn't any bedding for the sofa bed. When we pulled the bed out there wasn't enough room to move between bed and door without moving an exceptionally heavy coffee table. Unlike the hotel in Boston no-one put the sofa bed up in the evening, which would have been nice. After the shops/offices have closed the street is very quiet and we were approached several times for change, not sure if there was a soup kitchen or shelter close by but there seemed to be a lot of homeless people. We stayed in New York on four occasions and this was the worst hotel of all, we'll be moving uptown or further downtown next time. Cleanliness wasn't brilliant either, the bathtub was full of hair, as was the bathroom floor and we had to request toilet rolls too. There are vending machines located on several floors, but our floor wasn't operative when we arrived; we met a very nice lady who was going up and down in the lift trying to find drinks and ice. The hotel seemed very busy and going up and down from the 25th floor was a slow process at busy times like check in and out. We didn't use the restaurant but did have drinks in the bar which were a reasonable price for a hotel. We also experienced noise from a hotel roof bar in the street behind our hotel, so have a room at the front if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Grungy street, terrible elevators”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug1241
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a dirty, grungy street. The entrance is under scaffolding and it is very unappealing. The elevators are totally inadequate -- you wait and wait, and then they come totally full and you have to take the stairs. The rooms are clean but smell of sickly sweet chemicals. The bathroom hardware is falling apart. The gym is ok, but minimal. Good location but depressing place, and not cheap enough to make it worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, small rooms, pricey Internet”
Reviews.Author: PlanoPilot
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a boutique style to it that fits right in to the Chelsea area. The rooms are quite small but well appointed. No counter space in the bathroom. Staff service was superlative throughout the hotel. There are only two elevators for 20-something floors. Be prepared for a wait. Internet access is $10 per day PER DEVICE. So if you want to have wifi on both your computer and iPad, for example, it will cost you $20/ day. It's bad enough to charge for internet at a hotel of this caliber, but at the very least you should be able to connect all your devices without paying still more. To their credit the front desk did credit one device-day back to me, but it should still be free...for a business traveler Internet is a basic service.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: jjyotii
Reviews.Content: It's NOT a 4 start hotel like some places like Hotels.com rate it. The rooms are fine but the hotel is on par with a Hampton Inn or Holiday Inn. In fact, I much prefer the Hampton in just a block or two over. You have to pay $10/day for internet and it goes out every 45 seconds, the lobby is tiny and while the staff is nice they aren't very attentive. There are better hotels with free internet that are cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Niclas_Lund_Sweden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is smallish (some 15-20 yards or so across...), which translates into small rooms. Still, they managed to squeeze in two queen beds, a flatscreen tv, a bath tub and a marvellous view overlooking the Empire State Building. It is well-maintained, though - I consider it a typical four-star hotel, and I have seen many of those in various cities. The hotel's location is really good; two blocks from Penn station (definitely walking distance!), which is convenient if you land at Newark International Airport (the NJ Transit will take you directly from the airport train station to Penn station). You are roughly 50 yards from 6th avenue. Turn left and walk some three blocks up and you are at Broadway. Turn right and walk one more block and you are standing outside the entrance of the Empire State Building. The main advantage of the location isn't the proximity of Broadway and Empire State Building, however. Rather, it is the fact that the hotel is located in the middle of everything. Turn right at 6th av. and walk 2.5 miles and you are standing in Battery Park looking across at the Statue of Liberty. Turn left at 6th av. and walk 2.5 miles and you enter Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: mikeydc65
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Hilton guest, I expected more out of Doubletree. I have had great experiences with this chain in the past. The rooms are small. Dirty laundry as you arrive at the front door. NYC streets are smelly enough without having to run the gauntlet as you enter the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean, inexpensive. Good value. Cheap parking!”
Reviews.Author: AmyK41129
Reviews.Content: Had to stay overnight in NYC for a wedding. Hated paying so much for just a place to sleep and a parking space. Found this hotel and the reviews were good so we tried it. It was wonderful. Yes, the room is small. But you don't go to NY to spend time in your hotel room! For $22, we parked the car right across the street - as opposed to $50 everywhere else we considered. Fresh, warm chocolate chip cookies at check in. Can't beat it. Great price, safe, nice place. However - IF you are a tourist on a once-in-a-lifetime trip to NYC, I would not stay here. It is a little out of the way on a somewhat quiet street. It was a little deserted going back to our room late at night. In that situation, I would stay right near Times Square where things are a bit more hopping. But for our purposes, it was perfect. Finally - IF you stay here, and are driving in, the parking garage is slightly BEFORE the hotel across the street. Go into the garage, leave your car, and then get the ticket validated for the $22 rate - you pay when you leave. If you check in and THEN want to park your car, you've already passed the garage entrance (one way street) and have to go ALL THE WAY around several blocks, which takes another 15 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: markichaus
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Doubletree Hotel in Chelsea. It was pretty convenient to 6th Avenue and to Penn Station. It's a pretty new hotel, set back from the curb more than older buildings. The rooms were good size for NYC. The bed was comfortable. I was on the 22nd floor with a south facing room. The bathroom was nice as well. There wasn't a lot of room around the sink to put toiletries. The internet access was $9.95 a day and was provided by a third-party. I got connected wired and everything was good for about 10 minutes, then I lost the connection. I contacted customer support who gave me the usual troubleshooting suggestions. I tried their suggestions, but still no connection. It was late, so I went to bed. I woke up in the morning and had the same problem. After 3 more calls to the customer support line, I found out I had been blacklisted for using too much bandwidth. I had 5 windows open between 2 different browsers, which isn't a lot of bandwidth. I stayed at a different Doubletree 2 days later and had no problems with even more windows open. For some reason, they are really restricting the bandwidth at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: UpscaleButRealistic
Reviews.Content: Perfect for Business Travel. I am in this area for work often, and I've tried the Four Points down the street - the DoubleTree is WAY BETTER. It is NYC, so the room isn't huge. But, they have a breakfast buffet (THIS IS KEY), a decent gym (no view), and they give you warm cookies upon check in (yummy). The staff is very friendly. They do have good room service too. Even in a two double bed room, it woud be a tight squeeze for any more than two people.

Reviews.Title: “Abysmal service, lied about parking”
Reviews.Author: Michael1096
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons I chose this hotel was the fact they said they had $22 normal parking, as I had explained to their phone representative that I would need to use my car multiple times per day while in Manhattan, travelling to and from the airport, outer boroughs, etc. Their web site for this specific location states: Self Parking:22.00 USD $32 for SUV parking Even today, the site STILL has nothing about not having in/out parking, which any normal American will interpret as being able to leave and come back freely in a 24hr period! I arrived, only to discover that parking was on another avenue entirely -- another fact not advertised at all on their site. But OK, an annoying inconvenience, but I parked, and then when I needed to leave an hour later, I was informed that I would have to pay $22 *every time* I left and came back. The other DoubleTree locations on their website (doubletree.hilton.com) are quite explicit that in/out is not allowed, for example: Parking: Self Parking:35.00 USD per 24hrs:No in/out However, the Chelsea location does NOT include this caveat, which is why I chose it! I complained to the manager, who implied I was a fool for thinking *any* Manhattan hotel would have in/out parking regardless of what might be advertised, claimed he wasn't responsible for what the website said because it was "run by Hilton, not Doubletree" (which is ridiculous, since it is a Hilton franchise), and refused to limit the charge to the advertised $22. So I wound up paying hundreds of dollars more money than I had planned on (between taxis and extra parking fees) because of Doubletree's false advertising and the manager's refusal to adhere to advertised terms. In the end, I was left to tell the manager I would leave a 1-star review for his hotel because of the horrible service, and he said to go ahead -- so that's what this is, because one star accurately represents their false advertising, terrible and insulting service, and the fact I wound up spending much more money than they had led me to understand I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but extremely slow elevators!”
Reviews.Author: cruisernut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick weekend shopping trip and the hotel is ideally situated close to Penn station, subway, and stores. Rooms are tiny but you only sleep in them anyways. They are also clean which is always my first consideration. The only negative is it took forever for the elevators to arrive which in a 20+ story building is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to Madison Square Gardens!”
Reviews.Author: t-luvs2travel
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice, inexpensive stay in New York City, this is the place. 1st of all, you can get just about anywhere quicker by foot than car, cab or otherwise in New York. Having said that, I was looking for a nice, clean and affordable stay for one night to go to a Knicks game at the Gardens. The pros: the hotel is literally 5-7 min walk (depending on how fast or slow you walk) to Madison Square. The rooms are clean and you can request extra pillows and plush comforter free of charge. They offer free breakfast and its really good! You can order made to cook omelettes! The staff is really nice. One housekeeper, I forgot his name was very helpful with tips: where to go late night for snacks and etc. They gym is really nice, and really good equipment!! Oh and the welcome cookies were murder to my healthy eating but I ate one anyway! LOL!! The price is very reasonable compared to New York hotel prices and garage parking is directly across the street The Cons: The rooms are small, but that's typical in New York. Closet space was tight as well so if you're staying for DAYS, you may want to come up with something creative, like bring more clothes that can fold and go in the dresser drawers. They hotel only has 2 elevators, so depending on what time you check in, the wait to get to your room may be a little long and irritating. Once in your room just take the stairs, its quicker! The ice room is on the 2nd floor (I'm used to ice rooms on every floor) but thats no big deal either. All in all, the Doubletree CHelsea is good to go! And I will be using this hotel EVERY time I visit Madison Square Gardens in the future. OH forgot! They have this pizza delivery that will deliver nice HOT good New York piza directly to your hotel door until 5 am! LOL!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and service from all employees, front desk, restaurant and bellman.”
Reviews.Author: SLCPowellOH
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my daughter to New York for her college spring break. The hotel was an excellent location to be able to do lots of sights by walking north to Times Square, shopping, library, Empire State Bldg, Chrysler Bldg, Grand Central Station and south by Subway to Canal Street, World Trade Center area and on to Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry and South Street Seaport. The hotel restaurant was great. We only ate breakfast there each morning, but there was good variety and delicious. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Liz was our server each morning. It was nice to see her smiling face and she remembered what we liked to drink after the first day! The front desk staff, bellman and other employees were open and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, friendly and helpful staff, very clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SierraMadreTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend in NYC for a wedding and had a great experience at this hotel. Though the rooms are quite small, and noise occasionally wafts in from the subsequently tight hallways, it is to be expected in the close quarters of Manhattan. The noise was never an issue for us whatsoever. Rooms were very clean, seemed up to date. Breakfast was included as a Hilton Gold member and was also quite satisfactory - save the coffee, which in the opinion of this self-professed coffee hound was pretty rough. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly on several occasions. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy - Never again”
Reviews.Author: ducheau
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here four times since this opened a few years ago. It's my last time. I checked in about 8pm on Friday night and was given a room on a high floor next to a neon blue bar and a barking dog. I promptly called downstairs to be changed to another room only to be met with derision and insolence. "Oh we'll call you when we find something else for you." I waited 10 minutes no call. So I called back. "Oh we're still working on it." Waited another 10 minutes. I called again, this time someone else answered and had no idea that I wanted a room change. She agreed to change me but asked for me to come down and get the key. At this point I was really pissed off. It wasn't like they were that busy and the bellman could have easily brough the keys up to me. The second room they provided smelled of cigarette smoke. They say this property is non-smoking but don't believe it. I have gold status with hilton so I was given breakfast coupons. I came down around 930 and found most of the food was already gone. I had to ask three times for a glass of water. I don't think the staff gets it at this hotel. They're either poorly trained or just don't care. It's hard to believe that hilton rates this hotel as a category 7. I would say 5 at best and that's only because it's in NYC. avoid at all costs, very very dissappointing. I would recommend either the of the HGI's close by, they're much better.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: ariete415
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here last minute after our Valentine's dinner. I booked the night before and got the room for $150 including taxes. The one thing I hate about hotels is when the linens are old and outdated. This was not the case with this room, thankfully. The room was small, basically fit the king size bed with a small pathway in front and on the sides. The TV was large and had sooooo many channels. The bathroom was small but I've seen way smaller in Europe so it's not really a big deal, and what do you expect for NYC? We stayed in room 205. It was only one level up from the street and our view was the front so we faced the street. You would think that it would be extremely noisy but since it's facing 29th, it's not horrible. Also with the TV on, you can't hear a thing. The room was also right next to the stairs so I did hear some people walking up them but again, with the TV on you can't hear anything. The parking garage was across the street which was very nice to have. I live in Jersey so taking a train would've been more of a hassle and probably more expensive. Parking only costs $22 for 24 hours, normally that garage was about $45 for 24 hours. The next morning we decided to go out for brunch, they were able to hold our luggage until we got back. Overall, our experience was good. Staff was accomodating and friendly. The price was very inexpensive (however, that was due to the last minute reservation). The location is very central. Subways are very close, walking distance to Time Square for the tourists, in between 6th and 7th so catching a cab is very easy no matter what direction you are heading.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and NO bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: travelchick20807
Reviews.Content: Employees were great, rooms a bit small, but you're in NYC and you're not staying at the Plaza! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the budget and locale but thin walls and extra small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ahenri
Reviews.Content: I stayed end of January when a snow storm came through NYC, and as the other reviewers stated lobby is pretty small but that's not a downside. The front desk offered excellent service and prompt service checking in and out. The concierge was very helpful for a fast sightseeing trip before I left after working in NY for business. Hotel is what I expected for New York but this one was unlike others I've stayed in and probably would not stay here again. I could have stayed at the Lexington location for $10 more but it was the location I was looking for this trip however, that said, I'll pay the $10 more the next time as I've had great experiences at the Lexington hotel. My complaints were these: Extremely small room where I could barely get in with my suitcases. I mean it fills the need for a warm room and comfortable to sleep in but tripping over my stuff in the what felt like a 10x10 room. Main complaint are the thin walls and doors. All night I could hear foot traffic in the hall, and my neighbors conversations and blasting TV all night long. Not even the heater could drown out the sound all the way. I was exhausted from work and all I wanted to do was sleep and that was difficult. My other recommendation not to do, is to book the breakfast buffet for $5 additional. Not only do you get bad wet eggs, coffee and soggy french toast but you get additional tax on your hotel taxes too more than if you went outside of the hotel. I recommend walking towards 7th Ave. and on either corners of the street are two great places (Cafe Guy & Gallard on one side and a deli on the other) that have a good lox and bagal or egg breakfast sandwiches and a good cup of Joe for $6.50! Your stomach will love you for it than that awful buffet deal trap!

Reviews.Title: “extra charges and fees outway the value”
Reviews.Author: idaliss
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Nice little view of the empire state building from my 5th floor room. Got it on priceline for $88.00 alltogether so i thought that was a good thing. Upon plugging my laptop into the cord and trying to figure out the internet for a good hour i realized you must pay for their lousy slow internet for an extra 15.00 dollar charge to your room... ugh internet should be free. Not Fair! Also the $75 incidentals charge a night is a bit ridiculous. The room was fine but with all these hidden extras i worry about them trying to say i owe them for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place near Penn Station”
Reviews.Author: Madison90
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel because it was walking distance from Penn station, had a good breakfast, and it was a nice overall hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: amidttun
Reviews.Content: This was the worst treatment I've ever gotten from anybody. We prepaid our room, and when we arrived, they charged us one more time even tough we told them that we already had paid. After several remainders to the staff, they finally did something about it, but they couldn't give us the money back, because it was weekend. We asked for some compensation, but the only thing they could give us was some cookies that were old and dry. I am never ever going to use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Getaway Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JeffDianne
Reviews.Content: Spent this past weekend in New York and stayed at this hotel. Hotel is an easy 4 blocks from Madison Square Garden and the NJ Transit trains. From the 29th street location it is an easy walk for us to head down to the Village for a Friday night play and a longer but equally comfortable walk for us to Lincoln Center on Saturday. If you are not a big walker the bellmen are more than willing to help with a taxi. The staff was very pleasant and helpful without being overwhelming. The young lady who checked us in was an embodiment of that pleasant personna. Warm cookies on check in was a nice touch. Wall Street Journal available on Saturday. There is a small gym in the basement with new Precor equipment that was functional and up to par. Each unit has its own TV screen. The negatives mentioned in other reviews: The hotel elevators could be slow particularly at the more travelled times which can be expected. In the evenings and mornings when we come and go usually before or after the crowds we didn't find much problem. The room was small but as a place to sleep and change it was more then adequate. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. Flat screen TV, view of the Empire State Building, comfortable bed and very quiet for sleeping. The location is on a quiet street that can seem imposing in the late evening but as frequent travellers to the city and this area it isn't what it may look like. It is a shorter walk to come in from 6th ave to the hotel but we have never had a problem in this area. In the end a nice hotel with a nice staff. With every hotel there is always negatives for someone but for us there were no negatives that would deter us from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you know new York this place is excellent.”
Reviews.Author: laponzio
Reviews.Content: A few short blocks from Penn station and you can get anywhere for $2.00. Even us jet setters can enjoy a little of the dodgy side of town. Rooms are small..but who stays in the room. Bed is fabulous as are the nuetrogena products. And the price....good for a budget. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid of the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: mykelowery
Reviews.Content: After booking my trip to stay here, I read alot of the negative reviews and got frightened. My room had no issues, besides not being as big as my usual Hilton affiliated hotel rooms. The bathroom was small but manageable. The room was very clean. Due to the closeness to other rooms in the small hallway, I could see how one could possibly overhear people gathering in the hallways or a door slam shut. None of these issues happend during my stay. I guess I was booked into a good room (corner/away from elevator/23rd floor). I don't ever recall even waiting very long for a elevator. Honors members recieve free wifi/free breakfeast. Getting the warm cookies was always a plus after walking around during the winter in NYC. Penn Station is close as is the QNR subway on 28th. I'd definately stay here again, especially if they continue the military/gov "leisure" rate!!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway weekend!”
Reviews.Author: JimyDavid_8
Reviews.Content: From the moment we were greeted by the Doorman to check out, entire Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and sleep program is excellent. Rooms a bit smaller then usual, but its New York. Breakfast Buffet, good quality and always kept replenished. It was nice the friendly servers kept coffee cups filled, unusual for a buffet. Great Location! Will be my Hotel of choice for New York. I didn't receive my cookie, but I won't stay away because of such a minor detail. And free Wi-Fi would always be welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, great location, amazingly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: VeeVee007
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 weeks whilst working in the city. The rooms, bathrooms, facilities and cleanliness are all what you would wish to have - top notch. The aspect that really differentiates this hotel is the helpful and friendly staff - priceless. Amazingly located for Penn Station, Madison Square Gardens etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you are keen to walk NYC and get to know the place.”
Reviews.Author: Tradge
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree has a very small, cramped reception which is awkward during winter when everyone has luggage and tons of coats, hats, gloves etc. The hallways are narrow and rooms small. Having said that, it was all we needed as we only use a hotel to sleep and shower. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We could not get hot water in one of our rooms. Staff worked hard to fix it and the manager apologized and gave us a gift which was very kind.

Reviews.Title: “great locate”
Reviews.Author: LeonRFlorida
Reviews.Content: If your familiar with the city just a little then you will appreciate this hotel. The hotel is clean, comfortable and the room is fine. High def TV and comfortable bed. The staff was good but the location is wonderful if you use the subways and buses. Right between 6th ave & 7th ave its ideal for buses, & a few short blocks to herald Square where the majority of the subways run. Theres also subways on 23rd st too . You can walk to Macys, Penn station, Herald Square, empire state etc You can move around fast from this spot. Great bargain( January) too ill definitely come back .

Reviews.Title: “DoubleTree Chelsea - Nice... for a closet”
Reviews.Author: Patrick97401
Reviews.Content: The room was modern and clean, but I literally have a closet in my home larger than this room. My reservation was not correct (I'm a Gold VIP and requested a non-smoking room, they had me in a smoking room). I called room service for dinner at 10:45 (room services "closes" at 11pm). They told me - in a demeaning tone - that the kitchen was already closed and then put me on perma-hold. I would not stay here again at any price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff alone are not enough to provide good service or experience”
Reviews.Author: MitchLions
Reviews.Content: Some hotels are a little shabby or past their best, but still manage to provide a 5* experience due to the efforts and attitude of their staff. Unfortunately the Doubletree Chelsea suffers the opposite problem. The hotel and rooms are recently refurbished to a high standard, but the attitude of staff make staying difficult and uncomfortable. To start with the positives, the hotel is well located, just round the corner from Madison Square Gardens and Macy's. The rooms are a decent size, recently refurbished and clean, although I practically choked on air freshener when I first walked in. The 200 or so rooms are only served by two lifts, but the wait isn't too protracted. The staff are (for the most part) friendly and can handle most requests. However it is the unprofessionalism and lack of forethought that make staying at this hotel a struggle. When we arrived, our room not ready, and reception couldn't even tell us when it would be. Not what you need after a transatlantic flight. The staff were unable to manage my reservation properly, because I'd booked two consecutive nights separately, and made me check in again all over again the next day. To exacerbate this, they didn't think to update our key cards, leaving us locked out of our room. Finally there was a very noisy, industrial-sized ice machine next to our room, which stopped my girlfriend from sleeping. She asked repeatedly for it to be turned off, which never happened, until I found a simple switch and did it myself. In summary the staff can be friendly and the hotel is nice, but this is not a relaxing, carefree place to stay, because you have to do all the work yourself. If youâ€™re going to stay somewhere in this price bracket, go to a hotel where they really look after you, youâ€™re not short of options in NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: Fayths27
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting a bit of deal because we booked through HotWire, but we were really happy with the result. The rooms are small but clean, well furnished and provide all the standard amenities. The staff is attentive, very polite and helpful. We could walk to Time Square and it was 2 or 4 blocks from Penn Station. We were out at night and felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect rip-off”
Reviews.Author: selvagardena
Reviews.Content: We had 2 laptops and 1 smartphone and they made us pay 3 times 10 $ PER DAY (so 30 $ per day !!!!) only to use them on the internet When we complained, the told us : Sir, you had to know : in this hotel you have to pay again for every device you use...... (but is was not stated in the hotel policy) Rooms where ok, but very very small Location is not perfect We were so angry we even left without having breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Does a Disservice to Doubletree Name”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: Five night stay the week of Christmas. Did I make the wrong hotel choice? For me, the answer is YES. For others, maybe not. This property was originally built as a condo development and the design flaws therein are self-evident. This place would have been called a "traveler's hotel" when that term was widely used to describe lower-end, budget hotels that had a high transient rate. But let me start with the positives. The staff was gracious, polite, professional and helpful. The hotel and rooms are clean. The bed was comfortable and there is a large flat screen TV in each room. It has windows that open enough for fresh air. The climate control works well. The street is very quiet for Manhattan. So, in essence, this is a very nice BUDGET hotel. Now here's the problem - I don't consider Doubletree to be a budget chain and I hadn't planned in staying in one on this trip. I've stayed in tons of Doubletrees, mostly on the West Coast. They tend to be comfortable, upscale properties. Not this one in New York's Chelsea neighborhood. This one has budget written all over it, from the tiny lobby to the two overworked elevators to the tiny hallways and tiny rooms. Not only are the hallways tiny, but the noise is awful. People slamming doors and talking loudly like they're right outside your door. It reminded me of living in a dorm or rooming house. As Hilton Diamond member, I thought I'd get upgraded to a larger room. But no, not here. They seem to attract a sort of Eurotrash family clientele and younger visitors to the Big Apple. Even though the staff has been most pleasant, I would not ever stay here again or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ,better staff”
Reviews.Author: BandS1968
Reviews.Content: Minutes from Penn Station, easy access to rest of city. Although it was 9:00 AM they had and gave us a room. . It was cold but we walked to Rockafeller Center anyway , had lunch at Carnagie Deli , wandered to and gapped at Times Square. The staff was very helpful and courteous. We will return when we come by train

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Option in the Flower District”
Reviews.Author: Matombo
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance south of Times Square â€“ about 16 blocks â€“ and a couple of blocks from the subway lines at Madison Square Garden, and a few blocks from the Empire State Building, and Macy's, the Doubletree Chelsea was a good choice. Like most rooms in Manhattan, the room was very small, but it was decently appointed, with a small closet, a safe, a flat-screen t.v., and two comfortable queen-sized beds. The room still was not ready when we arrived at 5:00 p.m., but the staff was apologetic and courteous and made every effort to have the room available for us. We sat in the lobby and took advantage of the wireless internet for about 15 minutes before the room was ready. The bathroom, like the room, was tiny but well appointed. Towels were large and thick and there seemed to be plenty of hot water. There was just no place to put down anything larger than a toothbrush. We were on the 23rd floor and it was very quiet â€“ there only seemed to be 10 rooms on a floor â€“ and the elevators were reasonably prompt except around the peak hours. All in all, the location was acceptable, the hotel was comfortable but not lavish, and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs...”
Reviews.Author: njshore07
Reviews.Content: The location was great, very close to many NY attractions including Penn Station which makes getting to and from the hotel convenient. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the warm cookies upon check-in at the Doubletree are always a nice treat. Rooms are small-ish which is to be expected within New York City. The one major downfall was that the hotel only has 2 elevators to service the whole building, so if you need to get anywhere in a hurry during busy hours be prepared to either wait or take the stairs. All in all it was a good stay and it totally met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Small but great location and even better staff”
Reviews.Author: Kedrick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend, and even though the elevators (only 2 and small) made us wait longer than we liked and the soda machines were nearly empty, the friendliness and efficiency of the staff made these inconveniences easy to overlook. Little details mean a lot to this team (pressing the call button for the elevator when they see you approaching the front door, the bellman being ready to help with luggage but not asking to take your bag and making you feel guilty for not allowing him to earn a tip, saying good morning to you and using your name, etc.) and these details made our stay one of the best we've had anywhere. The location is great, too. Only one block from a subway stop on the red line and easy to walk to Times Square and the theatres. The room was a little small, but it was very clean and well appointed. The breakfast was very good, too. Plenty of hot protein as well as carbs and fats. While we love to try new places, we will probably just stay here again the next time we visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME STAY”
Reviews.Author: sunshine5287
Reviews.Content: .the location is amazing, its a 3 minute walk to PENN station. we walked back and forth to times square, its about a 15 minute walk. .the service was outstanding (they let us check in at 1130am and when it was time to check out they held our bags until it was time to go to the airport. This was amazing because I couldn't imagine dragging my suitcase around NYC) .the beds were comfy and the room size was perfect! i hate when people complain about room size, your in NYC who spends time in there room? .our TV's color was a little bit discolored but thats no biggie & the elevator was slow but we just took the stairs (a little exercise never hurt anyone) .i was a little disappointed that you had to pay for wireless internet however there is a free internet cafe in the basement

Reviews.Title: “Have better service than Jumeirah Essex House (seriously!)”
Reviews.Author: sinanissimo
Reviews.Content: OK, so I booked a room at this hotel last-minute at one of the cafes nearby as the other cheaper place I paid for turned out to be really crappy. And, I got a pretty good rate on one of the big hotel booking sites. ::PROS::: >> Good location: Between 7 & 8th Ave and on W29th St. Not in the crazyness of Times Sq., but not far from it. >>Really great service & staff: Two examples 1- Even though I arrived early for check-in and it was really busy at the front desk, the lady was super friendly and she commented on my Driver's License being from RI etc. And, she said a room was available on the 22nd floor, but it had two beds instead of one. And, she asked me if it would be OK ? I was like "are you serious!!" :)) That was awesome. 2- My family was staying at Jumeirah Essex House which is one of those unnecessarily expensive hotels with a Central Park view. And, I remember that they had a problem with the A/C in their room. A snobby weird dude showed up like 45 mins. later....BUT, at this inexpensive Double Tree I gave the front desk a call about my a/c not working properly and within 5 friggin minutes there was a polite guy at my door. :::CONS::: >>Wi-Fi is not really fast and it's $10/day... BUT they have a business center with free internet and there are plenty of Starbucks's and Pret a Manger's around with free wi-fi >> There are only two elevators for quite a lot of rooms. And, when one of them breaks down, you might wait for 5-10 minutes. But, it's not that annoying. You wait longer at Whole Foods or trying to find a cab. OVERALL, great and awesome place. I don't know if other negative reviewers had a one-time bad experience, because seriously, this place is just like your nice & clean, budget hotel for business travelers with a flat screen tv's in the room! :)

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE BUT WOULDNT STAY THERE AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: smiley4life2003
Reviews.Content: I went here this past weekend. The rooms are very small. Our room was dirty. Found trash under the nightstand when i was doing a check to make sure we were not leaving anything. Customer service was about average. They didn't try to go out of there way to help. Its in a great location, a few blocks from Penn Stataion and not to far from time Square. The price is reasonable but you should try to spend the extra bucks and stay somewhere else. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very consistent to Doubletree standards; great location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_And_Tell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business in November 2010 and highly recommend the Doubletree Chelsea for its close proximity to shopping, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, etc. It is also very consistent with Doubletree's standards as far as a hotel goes - extremely comfortable bed, very clean rooms, and don't forget the chocolate chip cookie you get when you check in! Loved it and would recommend. Great value (although I did book on Priceline to get my rate). Smaller rooms than you'd usually get in a Doubletree (I was in a double), however in NYC I am assuming that is the norm :) Not a lot of street noise at all!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shannonlg
Reviews.Content: Having never been to NYC and not wanting to spend a fortune on a hotel, I had expected many compromises in the accommodations. Instead, I found the DoubleTree to be the perfect home base between visits to amazing NYC attractions. Pros: clean and comfortable room and bed; excellent location 3 minute walk to subway or 20 to Times Square; helpful staff; small but functional fitness centre Cons: up to a 15 minute wait for elevators

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Bed, Nice Team and Rooms a Good Size for NY Standards”
Reviews.Author: bjspa
Reviews.Content: I was booked into room 504 with two double beds and the room was a good size for New York standards. Super comfy beds and the room was clean and modern. I overlooked the street entrance and it was good to be able to check the weather by looking out the window. I was offered 5 days free Internet access which was appreciated and a yummy warm cookie on check in. They have a small business center and you can print for free which is convenient for boarding passes etc. Their team is friendly and efficient and they have a variety of items should you forget them. Their sewing kit even had a mini pair of scissors in it which was perfect for de-tagging my purchases. I enjoyed this hotel and it was intimate by New York standards. It was also in a good location, Madison Square Garden is nearby and there are plenty of healthy take-away options and restaurants. When I was in the elevator I noticed one of the team had a tray of chocolate and fruit and he said it was for the 'guest of the day' - how cool is that?!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good--would recommend”
Reviews.Author: MayaMaine
Reviews.Content: High floor, very nice, clean room (of course it's small, it's NYC, people!) nice front desk staff and restaurant staff. Had one terrible, very expensive meal (dinner) at restaurant--didn't know breakfast was complimentary and actually bought breakfast off menu at restaurant the following morning--only to see a few people eating at the complimentary buffet while I was waiting for my 'ordered' breakfast--ugh. Good breakfast, though. Personally, had no problem with elevator/s--one was actually broken for a while in the morning--only one working. I was on nearly the highest floor and waited no longer than what I consider a reasonable amount of waiting time for an elevator under such conditions...felt bad for housekeeping staff, some of whom walked up 20+ flights of stairs to avoid using elevator for guests' sake. I paid $200+ tax for a very pleasant night in the Big A, and consider it a very good deal. Yes, the neighborhood is more "garment district" than "Chelsea"-- but I prefer to be somewhat off the beaten path. In summary, room- VG, bed excellent, service overall excellent, TV/selection/reception excellent, location VG, A/C worked great and no unpleasant odors in room or hallways, dinner at restaurant 'thumbs down, in-room coffee God-awful. The neighboring room inhabitants were quiet and respectful of one another, as was the housekeeping staff...no one disturbed me and had a perfect night's sleep at this very nice Doubletree Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Slamming doors, slam, rattle, rattle, clunk.”
Reviews.Author: John_Gymnast
Reviews.Content: Typical new construction maximize quantity of rooms, minimize service and room size. I've stayed here twice and have seen over 5 rooms all are very very small. I don't want to believe other reviews that say this but they are correct. There are only 2 small elevators for over 200 rooms so you'll be waiting or skipping an elevator because it's full. The service is good and the rooms are clean. You do have to pay for wifi for each device you have. It took 11 minutes to watch a 2 minute video on YouTube. The wifi is very slow and patchy. Since the rooms are so small and there are usually 6-8er floor they are veer close together with a narrow hallway. Whenever some one leaves a room the doors slam closed and rattle into place. It's so loud I thought it was my room door that was being shut. The location is great especially if you come into NYC via Penn Station. I would not stay here again. If you do a high floor means a long wait for an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “It's not "Chelsea" but it's a very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovestayinginhotels
Reviews.Content: I'm Hilton Gold VIP, I was looking to stay somewhere in Chelsea and so I found this property. This particular week was very difficult for finding NY hotels, everything was sold out or extremely expensive but I found a pretty decent deal here and booked it. The person at the desk was very nice and accommodating, let me check in early and let me change rooms the next day. If you have Hilton status, you get free warm cookies at check-in, free breakfast, free internet, and maybe an upgraded room depending on availability. The breakfast is very good - gross tasteless pancakes but everything else was decent - eggs, pastries, cereals, yogurt, fruits, juices, the usual. The rooms are modern, clean, not bad at all. It's a Doubletree. That means it is a low-mid-range chain hotel, and so it doesn't have character or trendiness, it is just a nice clean basic new hotel. If that's what you need in NYC, this is the place. It's true about the elevators - there are long waits. There is no service elevator in this compact building (25+ floors but each floor is very small), and so the housekeeping staff uses the same elevators as guests, and they are pushing the big carts in and out of there. But there are much worse things to happen, I got over it. So I had a great stay. The only real complaint I have is that this hotel is NOT in Chelsea. It is a short walk to Chelsea. It is also a very short walk to Penn Station which is convenient. But if you are looking for Chelsea specifically, be warned this hotel is about 5 blocks north and 2 blocks east of anything truly "Chelsea". This hotel's actual street is NOT sketchy or dangerous, like some people have suggested, it is a perfectly fine street. But it is a completely bland street, there is literally nothing of interest on the block. When walking home at night, you will find yourself walking away from interesting neighborhoods into a very bland generic empty dark street, with mostly closed shops, and the Doubletree, and nothing else. But it's a great value, great amenities for VIPs, and it was new and clean and modern, plenty of outlets, etc. The rooms are typical NYC rooms - small. But they aren't outrageously small, and they definitely are not the smallest rooms I've ever seen in NYC. Try staying at the Paramount or the Hudson - you'll learn what small rooms are. These rooms are very typical european/nyc-sized. And, I saw two rooms, both about the same size, one king, and one double-double, and there wasn't a lot of room to walk around but enough. (I am guessing people on here must not understand what NYC apartments are like, either.)

Reviews.Title: “Full of partiers and tour groups”
Reviews.Author: cdstour
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and tidy, although ridiculously small, even by NYC standards (barely enough room to walk around the bed - and that's it). I usually think of Doubletree as a business class hotel but we stayed mid-week and our floor was full of loud people talking, laughing and slamming doors all night long (until 5:00am). It felt like Cancun at Spring Break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: KJRJDR
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel, I was a bit apprehensive about making a reservation. When I arrived I was greeted pleasantly by the front desk. The room was typical New York size, but clean and comfortable. The bed was amazingly comfortable. The elevator was at times slow, but the wait was never too long.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: misscbanks
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Doubletree Hotel Chelsea from August 12- 15th 2010 and our stay was absolutely the BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, they treated us like family, they went above and beyond to meet our requests and we will definitley be staying there again whenever we are in NYC . I would reccommend this hotel to anyone taking a NYC vacation!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thanks Doubletree staff, you are were wonderful!!!!!!!!!!!!!! By the way, the hotel was spotless and that is always a PLUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: RyryE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Doubletree, and we were very happy with the quality of the room and price that we payed. The location is excellent when you consider that you are not paying for a Times Square or other prime spot. The hotel is located on West 29th Street between 6th and 7th. There is a subway stop just around the corner (28th Street), and Penn Station is a short walk of five blocks, or so. We were able to use the hotel as a good base for our stay to take the subway to certain locations or walk to others. We drove into the city, and the hotel is only about 10 blocks from the Lincoln Tunnel, so that was convenient, as well. Since parking in New York is very expensive, we were very happy to find out that the Doubletree had self parking about two blocks away for just $22 per 24 hours. The hotel itself is in very good condition and has average size (small) rooms for New York City. We did have a nice view of the Empire State Building, which was nice. While the room is small, it has all of the usual amenities one would expect from a Doubletree, and we had a very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. Several of the reviews I read before booking the hotel commented on the friendliness of the staff, and after our visit, I would say the same thing. The front desk and bell staff was extremely courteous and helpful. We asked questions of both, and they were more than willing to help us out with getting to the right place. I would certainly stay here again on another trip into New York.

Reviews.Title: “The Smoking Lounge”
Reviews.Author: dawgs002
Reviews.Content: During my recent trip to NYC, I had booked a room at the Doubletree Chelsea. When I got there, I was given a smoking room and when I got there it had as much smoke as a smoking lounge at the airport. Asked mgmt to book me at another NYC hotel, which they refused as "they had an available room". If you are on business, I would STAY AWAY, as they are neither helpful nor run a practice. Back to Marriott...

Reviews.Title: “Right price. Decent location.”
Reviews.Author: rkfdtraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff were incredible. Although small, the room was efficient. The hotel has double beds, though, which did not give us enough sleeping room. One of the beds was pushed up along the wall so entry was made only from one side or the bottom. It would have been nicer to have queen sized beds, even if it meant losing a foot or so of very limited floor space. The staff were extremely pleasant. The only trouble we had, for some reason, was with towels. The cleaning person would take the towels, even if we had hung them up for re-use, but they were never replaced! One day, they replaced the bath mat, but not the bath towels! We had to ask for towels to be delivered every day. We would stay at the hotel again, although, for our purposes, it would have been better to be a little closer to Times Square or the Upper West Side.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this hotel, it's not worth the aggravation!”
Reviews.Author: EdIsOnTheRoadAgain
Reviews.Content: Spend two long weekends a year in Manhattan. My wife and I love it their. We decided to explore Chelsea. I am a Hilton Honors member so, we chose the Double Tree Chelsea as our hotel. Wrong decision; let me recap what happened. The housekeeping was either totally overwhelmed or totally under engaged. I would think the former. Terribly slow elevators, extremely small room (even for Manhattan), rough neighborhood after dark. I won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite NYC Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: Phil2016
Reviews.Content: Everyone has different needs from a Manhattan property, but for me, the DT Chelsea has become my favorite hotel since it opened. Since I use JFK, the access to Penn Station makes getting to/from the hotel a breeze (and cheap) via LIRR/AirTrain. Short walk to a variety of subway lines. Away from all of the tourists and conveniently located between Times Square, Midtown, and Downtown. The free breakfast for HHonors Gold/Diamond is actually a full breakfast, not just fruit and stale pastries. The gym, though small, has everything one needs to maintain their at-home fitness regiment. The rooms are typical NYC tight, but with only 10 or so rooms per floor, it is QUIET! I never hear outside noise either, so good quality windows were used. Beds are great, bathrooms are spacious enough and tidy. TVs actually have HD programming and tons of channels. At the end of the day, a staff can make or break a hotel. The staff here are truly fantastic. Very friendly and accommodating. Willing to go above and beyond for their guests. And they remember you, even if you only stay once a month (and not just when they're looking at their computer screens to know who you are). Of course...the DT cookie is always a nice touch. And there's a great little barber shop next door if you need a trim.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Marathon weekend - a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yankeegirl13
Reviews.Content: spent a night in the city with my son to see some sights and spend some quality time together. The staff at the hotel were helpful and very nice. It was Marathon weekend in the city and we were able to get a great rate (by NYC standards) Check out Mustang Sally's down the street for a burger and a beer. Room service for dessert was a great treat.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, SERVICE, PRICE”
Reviews.Author: oliljuli
Reviews.Content: Look no further if you're looking for location and great service!! The hotel is on a side street, but is really close to transportation and everything! Although the rooms were small, our beds were SO comfortable. What more could you expect though? It's NYC. I slept so well every night. The restrooms were adequate and clean. Service was amazing. The front desk help was great! William Landicho helped us with everything that we needed. From an appropriate room for loud girls partying for the weekend, to the great delicious warm cookies compliments of the hotel, to offering us advice on the hot-spots to hit up during our weekend stay. I'd definitely recommend this hotel for great service, great location and decent price. I'd definitely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful experience in NY”
Reviews.Author: bluerose106
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the weekend with a few friends. It was a great stay. The rooms were very clean, beds were sooo comfortable, and staff were very friendly and helpful. We needed towels and they were sent to our room in minutes. Breakfast was very good- had a great variety and also stayed opened pretty late. Location is great- easy to get a cab and also very close to lots of great restaurants. BIG plus- you can walk to the hotel from Penn Station. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good NY Hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: luckydog818
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. I was pleasantly happy with this hotel. Checkin was nice and friendly. The room, while small, was typical size for NY, and I've had smaller. I actually thought it was quite fine. It had everything I needed and wanted. All was as expected. The bed was great and comfortable. I liked the location. It was good for where I needed to go and I travel to NY once or twice a year so I am familiar. I like that its not in Times Square or a tourish area, but close enough to walk to Penn Station or most other places. I think its centrally located. My next trip is in September, and I plan to stay here again. I have stayed at many other places, but for the money, this is a great hotel. Its what you expect from a business class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This couldn't be it...”
Reviews.Author: PhelpsRoad
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is on 29th st. Between Broadway and 7th ave. They pile the trash right at the front door. The staff was helpful, though we booked two rooms and they could only find one in our name even though we had confirmation of two rooms. They told us they were oversold and could only give us a room with two double beds. This wasn't our problem, but they did nothing to make it right except for giving us complimentary wifi. The rooms are typical, small, New York rooms and were very overpriced for the spartan space provided.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms, but ok for the price.”
Reviews.Author: shesgruven
Reviews.Content: We arrived super early (our plan landed at 7am) and went straight to the hotel to see about early check in. We pretty much thought "no-way", but they would at least hold our bags for us so we could grab breakfast. Julie at the front desk was very accommodating to get us into a room at 10am for 8th fl. we could have had the 16th fl at noon, but we weren't concerned about a view & read the reviews about slow elevators. Hotel is very small buy by no means uncomfortable. I almost opted out of this hotel because of all the bad reviews for the elevator, but we did not have one issue with waiting times. We were a party of 4 with major luggage & were able to fit into the elevator. There are about 7 rooms to a floor and we never heard our neighbors. We did hear the ice machine, but our room was right next to it. It was a little noisy, but it did not keep us from sleeping. Nice Neutrogena products in the bathroom and wonderful beds and pillows...like sleeping on a cloud. Air con was a dream. No smells, our room very clean. I wonder if this is just hit or miss. We were on the street side, but no noise. Here are the cons: super duper small rooms. Beds right up against the wall. No place to store your luggage. Sink in bathroom is at a weird angle because it is so small. Can't really relax in your room after a day of sightseeing unless you want to hop into bed. Forget about the ridiculous tiny closet they put into the room. The rooms actually do not have closets, but they bring in a tiny wardrobe. It is ok for short trips, but I think I would go stir crazy if I had to stay here for more than a few days. Location seemed a bit shady at night since everything else on the block is closed, but just a few blocks from the shopping areas and wonderful Korean restaurants. Here is my big peeve about the place. I requested a refrigerator the night before I left for my trip by calling the hotel. I am a breastfeeding and needed a hotel with a refrigerator. They tell me they don't have any fridges in the rooms. I acknowledge this, but tell them I read on their website that although no fridges are in the rooms, one can be requested to be brought in for an additional fee. He tells me "oh, we don't do that anymoreâ€� and I tell him "well, you should update your website thenâ€� and he had no response. I asked what does the hotel do for breastfeeding mothers or those who require a refrigerator for medications. He says "well, I don't think we could keep in the hotel fridges cuz that would be a health hazard." WTF??? I am glad I called before hand so I could make arrangements at another hotel. I did keep the first couple of days here and just used a cooler and ice, but this was totally inconvenient for me. It was ok for a couple of days, but I would not stay here again with all the other options around town.

Reviews.Title: “Stinks...literally”
Reviews.Author: mswrb
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was new and near our NYC office. As soon as I walked in the pint-sized room I wanted to gag - everything REEKED of mildew. I called the front desk to see if I could be moved but of course all the rooms were booked up for that night. I had to at least crack the window - they sent someone up quickly to do that. I couldn't sleep all night - the stench of mildew just assaulted my nostrils every which way I turned. Absolutely gross. I got in and out of the reeking shower as fast I could. Though there were no visible signs of dirt the stench was everywhere and overwheming. I didn't have to be at the office until 7:30 am - I left at 6:30. And I am NOT an early riser. That should say it all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: cmd108
Reviews.Content: This place was awful. To give a little background, I stayed here with my husband whose job reserved this for him (obviously without any research) because of its proximity to Jersey City. I lived in Manhattan until July 2009 and now live in Connecticut and commute to Manhattan daily. Anyway, (1) Terrible location. If you want to be near local 'garment district' and 'wholesale florists' then this is the place for you. Everything is closed after 5pm. This is not Chelsea. This is a small section of hell just south of Penn Station and Macy's. (2) I felt like the cigarette burns on the carpet in our room were left by the Korean Pro's from 32nd Street (K-Town, or Korea-town) nearby (3) our room was OK, other than the carpet, seemingly clean. flat screen TV, comfortable bed, etc. VERY tiny. VERY tiny bathroom. Small. Really. Really. Small. (4) I had to sleep with earplugs in my ears. I could hear everything in the room(s?) next door. Plus, doors slamming ALL NIGHT LONG. I get that it was cheap, but seriously, there are other well-priced hotels in the city, I would think (I don't know for sure, b/c since I lived here I never really stayed in hotels here). If it was like 4 blocks south of where it is, the location would have been much better. If it wasn't Manhattan, which is a super safe city generally, I would have been scared to walk down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good location, and the best beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: AndreGL
