Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Hotel, very good location, near a coffeshop, just blocks away from Empire State, and Macy's, so you can actually walk to many of the principal places, like the Times square and go to the broadway show, or a cab would be actuall cheap. The subway station is just 4 blocks away, with the red line that will take you to all the other must see places in NY. The hotel staff is very welcoming, with the delicious hot cookie. The room are quite small, but considerin it's NY city, it's ok, and confortable. The bed are the best one we've had in the whole trip, we slept really good, almost to good we didn't want to get up in the morning. I recoment completly this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! this is the smallest hotel I have EVER stayed at. Looks like a college dorm room”
Reviews.Author: bripal
Reviews.Content: Here are the "positive things". Friendly staff, and great cookies at check in. Now goes the truth. The area of the hotel is NOT nice, Yes, it's walking distance to many places, but don't expect a pretty area. My view was to a NASTY and dirty alley. For those people from L.A. is just like being right in downtown between Broadway St. and 5 st. The hotel is SMALL!!! I have NEVER stayed in a hotel this small in my life. The lobby is so small that only about 10 people (if that) fits. Now, you go up to your room, OMG! my daughter's room is bigger than that one, it's so tiny that it was hard to walk inside without bumping into my husband, yes THAT small. We had to double beds, and it was just cramped! I asked for a luggage rack 5 times, the last time was at 9:30 p.m. NEVER got it! complained again in the morning, I did NOT received the the item until 11:00 a.m. For the price you pay, stay somewhere else, at least somewhere where you get a "decent" size room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Fab Beds!”
Reviews.Author: ukv
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good placements if you have a few downtown meetings or even a few spread out across Manhattan. It was a bonus as my first time in NY that Its also placed so that you can actually visit Rockerfeller/Times SQ/Empire State and Little Italy in big square walk. The Beds were amazing,.....not sure what it was but i slept the best i had in years!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: kelpudrah
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel in good situ. Clean & very comfortable rooms, though a bit small. Bed SOOOO lovely. Breakfasts good, plenty of choice At busy times lift can take ages. Really enjoyed City, tons to do & see. Empire, Rockafella, Statue Liberty & Time Square to mention only a few. ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, a bit cozy with a decent location in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: puddlejump
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and modern, but they definitely could use one more elevator during the peak hours. The rooms are cozy, not a whole lot of space to roam around, since the beds take up the majority of the square footage. Their public areas are nice, but once again, slightly cramped, but then again in Manhattan, you will find plenty to do outside the hotel! A reliable choice, but the location is somewhat average comparatively. Parking is a few blocks away, and I was able to get a better parking deal over by 8th Avenue. No pool, no free breakfast, no free internet. I had a room on the 20-something floor, with a good view of the Empire State Building, which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty decent place”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluedk
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Hotel is actually a very good hotel. Pros: Location (Very close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, Macy's,Empire State Building, Times Square) Safe and quiet neighborhood Spacious rooms (by NYC standards) Cons: Only two (very busy) elevators, which is a problem if you're on the 11th floor Housekeeping could a bit faster (one day we got clean towels at 5.30 pm). Very friendly staff, though. If you end up staying there, you should definitely go and have breakfast at the deli on the corner of 29th and 6th Avenue. A very local place with great bagels. Not a tourist at all, we went liked it a lot for the very local atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: edenpt
Reviews.Content: We checked in promptly and were pleasantly greeted and given an upgraded room as we are Gold Members. The room was very nice, clean with a nice view of Empire State Bldg. As the case of many hotels in Manhattan, the room and bath were small but adequate and well appointed with a large LCD TV and marble in the bath. The bed was like most Doubletree's one of the most comfortable you could find! The buffet breakfast is good, but even better if you are fortunate to have the eggs brought out when you arrive.Very friendly and attentive service for your drink needs. The entire hotel staff were very friendly and helpful!!! We stayed previously at the Hampton Chelsea and this is a step up. It had adequate computer room and workout room. The hotel has a very good location and Herald Sq and 34th St are close by. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: vainu
Reviews.Content: Picked a 200-250 usd category hotel. It is situated on a rather deserted street, but there are food and entertainment places just a block away. However, expected more from the hotel. The lobby was tiny and so were the rooms. Not too much space to move and this is the reason why the 2 star rating. It is clean and everything but for this price expected a bit more breathing space in the overcrowded city. Warm cookie at check-in was a nice touch though :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Gmac38
Reviews.Content: What time should housekeeping clean your room. 9am? 11am? At the Doubletree Chelsea, the answer is 5pm. That's right, just around the time you need to get ready for dinner. And when you ask if someone can come back at 7pm, the answer is "sorry that's too late." So, I made my own bed. For $250 a night, I'll go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ChaosCashew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right inbetween about 4 subway enterances. You can see the lights from Time Square from the corner of the street. There is a fantastic deli on the corner with well priced food for a which morning or late morning meal. The neighborhood is safe; I'm a small girl and walked all over the area at 11pm getting pizza and felt perfectly safe. This hotel is by 8th avenue which has about 15 pubs and tons of other stores. The windows open, the rooms were clean, the bathrooms were clean. The staff was so nice and cookies were delightful. This hotel was slightly over my budget, but I would gladly pay again for the location and the safety not to mention how nice the workers are.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Lynnja
Reviews.Content: So for starters, if you're looking to stay on the island of Manhattan, there has to be a base understanding that real estate is at a premium here - whether it is with apartments, condos or hotel rooms. So to expect an extravagantly sized hotel room in Manhattan - especially at an affordable price - is an extremely tall and rather unrealistic order. That being said, I stayed at the Doubletree Hotel Chelsea with a friend in February 2010. The exterior of the hotel is quite nice - modern and recently done up. The lobby is rather small though. They have 2 small elevators at the hotel - both of which seemed to run very slow. The small theme continues on in the rooms. We booked a hotel room for circa $150 for a Friday evening stay in NYC - very good deal. The hotel is well situated in Chelsea - within walking distance of many hot spots in midtown. What I didn't like was that the hotel is located on a block of 29th Street which is rather dimly lit at night. Other than that though, I felt safe staying in this hotel. As mentioned earlier, the size of the room was rather small though it was modern and well appointed. The room was CLEAN - which is most important. The bathroom was a reasonable size. We found it a plus that their bathrooms were stocked with Neutrogena items. The beds were comfortable for sleeping. The room came with a flat screen television. I would definitely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to a friend. The friend who shared the hotel room with me is a member of the Hilton Honors program and with that we received 2 free bottles of water with the room. We also received the signature Doubletree cookies at check in. These are admittedly small perks but they were nonetheless a welcome treat to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: BubbleDublin
Reviews.Content: I went back to NYC for a short break and booked the Double Tree. Although i didnt know its exact location, it ended up being the perfect base for my trip. The double tree has a very warm and friendly atmosphere and the staff and especially the porters are an invaluable source of information. When you arrive you get one of the Doubletree cookies - which is warm and delicious! I was a little surprised with the size of the room, though I cannot fault it. The room is extremely comfortable, and the bed is one of the most comfortable I've stayed in. Macy's is about a 5 minute walk up the road, and there are plenty of great restaurants in the area, which the staff can recommend to you. Our room was definitely nicer than the one my friends stayed in ( i think due to the layout) but then again why would you spend alot of time in a hotel room when you are in New York?

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, and good customer service”
Reviews.Author: irishsnowbunny
Reviews.Content: Small but functional and well decorated rooms on West 29th Street. Central location makes it very easy to navigate around. Street is a bit strange with it's array of "TAX ID Required" shops selling all sorts of tat, but other than that the location is great!! One small fault is that there are only 2 lifts servicing all floors so you can be left to wait quite a while on a lift... Staff very very friendly and helpful. We were sharing a two double bed room among three and had plenty of room for three suitcases, but the beds were slightly narrow for two people to share for more than a few nights

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain in Chelsea!”
Reviews.Author: nd8688
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my 11 year old son on the "Bed & Breakfast" rate of $144/night. This property is almost brand new (less than a year from what I understand) and located about one block from the 28th street subway station (on 7th Ave). While compact, the lobby was clean if spartan. After the efficient check-in (with cookie, actually warm), we headed up to a clean, comfortable room with a view of the Empire State Building. The room was on the small side, with small wardrobe and not much extra room for the suitcase (one shared between us). Breakfast was great, with a made-to-order omelette and a nice selection of breakfast buffet items in a bright, airy dining area. Part of Hilton, so you get HHonors points. Staff was quite helpful in answering questions and providing advice on getting around the area. Within easy walking distance of the Empire State Building. For the price, location, cleanliness, newness, and breakfast, I found this to be a great value and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Only negative is the additional charge for internet, although there is a business center downstairs where I understand internet is available at no extra charge (I did not use it, so can't verify it).

Reviews.Title: “Twins at the Double TREE”
Reviews.Author: byelderman
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit to NYC & The Martha Stewart show about twins~ The Double Tree was a very nice and convenient place to stay. The service from the Front Desk & Manager were great. We had a bit of the problem with the Concierge but it is a brand new hotel so they are working on the kinks! We had a FANTASTIC STAY at the Double Tree in Chelsea!

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Getaway in NYC - Doubletree Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: Pebbles1633
Reviews.Content: Well folks this hotel is in a great location, close to subway station, walking distance to Union Square, Hearld Square and in a relatively quiet part of NYC. Unfortunately we were on the 2nd floor of this hotel...surrounded by maids carts everyday, all day. This floor apparently was the holding ground for the hotel's maids carts. Probably due to lack of storage space, they left the carts in the hallways, which obstructed passage. It made it quite difficult to pass when you had luggage. The upside, unlimited product whenever you wanted. They do carry Neutrogena products, so we stocked up! A bit of attitude was received from some maids and front desk managers, but really overall this hotel would be recommended again in the future and we would stay again...just don't stay on the 2nd floor!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice near midtown”
Reviews.Author: thomasbaker
Reviews.Content: Tiny, clean, comfortable room, and a friendly staff. Be prepared for a dark, completely deserted (but not terribly dangerous) street at nighttime, with all the rest of the block made up of storefronts covered by iron gates. But there are a couple of good places (esp. Seven) to get a quick drink or dinner about a block away on Seventh Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing for Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: beaachhgirl
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Hilton guest - I prefer Embassy Suites & Doubletree. As a new hotel, I had high hopes for this one. But 3 nights was too much. The room was clean, but the staff was rude. I didn't get my wake up calls, the car they reserved for my 5am airport ride was $15 more than what they quoted. The 2 small elevators were slow & inadequate this this 26 (i believe) floor hotel. The restaurant staff was pleasant, but for an early breakfast with only 2 tables occupied, the service was VERY slow - and I only ordered oatmeal. I would stay here again ONLY if I got a very cheap rate. Otherwise, I would forfeit getting Hilton points for a stay at a hotel whose staff actually cared that you were there. Also, the room price that I quoted was more upon arrival. The desk couldn't help & asked me to come back the next day to speak with the mgr - this was inconvenient as I was on a very tight busines schedule. However, 2 more visits to the desk finally produced a very uncooperative mgr, who finally begrudgingly gave me the rate quoted. Too much of a hassle to seriously consider this hotel again. If you're looking for a Doubletree in NYC, go to Doubletree Times Square or the Metropolitan on Lexington - much preferred.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Decor--Small Rooms--Awful Elevators”
Reviews.Author: jogenth
Reviews.Content: We went to see Bruce Springsteen at MSG--was a great location--rooms reminded me of Europe--small but very functional--it was the elevators that drove me crazy--there were only 2 & it went to I think 26 floors--unbelieveably slow slow slow--so bad in fact that I would choose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel, tiny but well decorated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mowe25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the doubletree in the new year, was suprised how small it was ,the loby and lifts were fine but other public areas not so good, needed a good vacum! The breakfast was adequate, nothing special for the money. (no bread for toast )! The room was tiny but decorated to a high standard and was clean. Hotel staff were exeptionally helpful and friendly The ouside of the hotel is scruffy with big plastic skips full of dirty laundry overflowing.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find in NYC - Clean, Good Location, & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sannicandrob
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Gold VIP so I'm pretty familiar w/ the Hilton family properties in NYC, but I had no idea this hotel even existed. Its fairly new and I scored a great last minute rate for a weekend stay with my wife and four children. It's on 29th, near Madison Sq Garden & Penn Station so convenient to subway/taxi. Less than 5 minute subway trip to Time Sq or Columbus Circle. We arrived late Fri evening and were greeted by very friendly bell hop who advised me I could park in the street (at my own risk) and would avoid $22 per day fee at nearby garage they have an arrangement with. I thought that was nice and I got a spot right across the street from the hotel. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly - from bell, to front desk, to maintenance. Had a room on the 17th floor. The hallway and rooms were modern & clean. Like most NYC hotels, they were quite small, but I've come to expect that in Manhattan. Just nature of the beast. Beds were comfortable, flat screen TV, and typical amenities of an upscale business hotel. Staff provided extra cookies at check in for my kids which I thought was a nice gesture, especially because I travel 2-3 times per month on business all over the country and am used to getting nickled & dimed most of the time. We were pleased with our stay and I would definitely come back. It was a great weekend in NYC

Reviews.Title: “A lot of hassle for the cheap price”
Reviews.Author: gogogo2
Reviews.Content: This is one of the new mini Hiltons in Manhattan. I've stayed at several of them and expected this hotel as a Doubletree to have something better. In fact, the room was as small, if not smaller than the nearby Hampton Inn (which at least has free wi-fi) and HGI Chelsea, a block away. We stayed because the price was very good but the elevators, tiny rooms and poor service in the restaurant really tried our patience. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good,but”
Reviews.Author: oldtrowel
Reviews.Content: A central location in a quiet street -though the street looks rough. Friendly staff. Rooms small, not big enough for the king sized bed making it difficult to move around. Only two lifts/elavators for more than 20 floors meant that eveyone had to wait for long periods. Expensive and unchanging breakfast if buying separately. Other reviews said that free Wifi available in lobby-seems to have been stopped, good wifi available in rooms if you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good central location, excellent rates as we booked via hotwire.”
Reviews.Author: madmoose79
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't built when we booked it through hotwire, so we really were risking it. But for the amazing price of $101 per night, we couldn't turn it down. Being a new hotel, when we went in November 09, it had only been lived in for approx. 4/5 months, so the rooms, the fixtures, fittings and the beds were all fairly new. We were greeted by a friendly lady in the reception, who checked us in and gave us warm complimentary cookies - much needed after a long and early flight from the UK! We hot-footed it to our room on the 7th floor - no wait for the lift as others have reported. Room was small but perfectly formed for our 5 night stay. Bathroom was clean and well maintained. We had an issue with water coming from a ceiling fan one morning, but called reception and they got a handyman on the case that morning. So all fixed for when we got back to the hotel in the afternoon. The location is great, not far from Madison Square Garden, Macy's etc. and a short walk from Times Sq. The subway was quite close too. There was a lovely organic cafe just around the corner from the hotel, where we had breakfast most days - delicious bagels and fresh juice. I would recommend this hotel to others, we had a really enjoyable stay there and for the price we got it for it was perfect. I'd say check on Hotwire if you're not concerned which particular hotel to stay in, you just choose the area you want to be in and www.betterbidding.com helps when trying to identify the exact hotel. It worked out really well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here -- 10 minute wait for elevator, closet sized room, chaos in lobby”
Reviews.Author: Travel4WorkAndFamily
Reviews.Content: The room was the smallest I've ever stayed in. Seriously. We were here with our young children and the room with two double beds was a joke -- literally two feet between the beds and 8 inches on either side of the beds. There is no closet (only a tiny wardrobe that you couldn't close the doors to once you put coats on the hangers), and no room for suitcases, much less a stroller or any other parcels. It was ridiculous. But it gets worse. This is a 27 story building with only two elevators that guests have to share with the cleaning service people. The usual wait on an upper 20s floor was at least 10 minutes in the morning. The maid on our floor complained to me that she had to wait 45 minutes to catch an elevator up to the top of the building to start her cleaning because there were so many guests waiting in the "lobby" (more on the "lobby" in a moment). When the elevator finally arrived, we literally stopped at every other floor on the way down. The elevator filled up after 3 stops, but it still stopped at nearly every floor and people who clearly wanted to leave (they had their roller bags with them) would have to wait for another elevator. The "lobby" was always freezing cold (late December) because the lobby is about the size of two of the rooms put together and the automatic doors were constantly opening and closing. It was the least welcoming lobby I've ever been in. And it was jammed with people waiting for the elevators. The restaurant with the "free breakfast" for Hilton Honors members was constantly running out of food and plates. Food was ok. The staff was very friendly. No complaint about them. They're doing the best they can in a ridiculous facility. The rooms were clean and new. And the price was ok for holiday season, but nothing great. But even if I paid half the price I paid (high $200s), it wouldn't be worth it. A decent hotel room can be a nice place to rest up after a day of touring the city ... but not in this hotel. You can't turn around in the room without bumping into someone or something. Don't stay here. I saw the reviews mentioning the small rooms and only two elevators and thought "how bad could it be?" Well, now I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you're going to Madison Square Garden, etc.”
Reviews.Author: patbiswanger
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location on 29th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues, about two blocks from Madison Square Gardens and Penn Station. I usually stay in midtown, so this was something different, and I really liked the accessibility to the train, plus the neighborhood. 29th Street itself is lined with stores selling handbags and belts, which was interesting, and there are lots of good restaurants nearby, in Chelsea. The hotel was very nice: rooms are small, but what do you expect in New York City? The bathrooms (we had two rooms) were immaculate, and the furniture was cleverly designed to hold the most stuff in the smallest space. All in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for the money, but...”
Reviews.Author: wineguysf
Reviews.Content: Checked in today. Nice hotel. Really matter of factly, there is nothing wrong with this hotel. The staff is friendly, it is clean, the rooms are fine (small, but fine), all is new, it's nice. Another thing that is very important, at least for my stay, what you get for the dollar is simply very very good. My nightly pre-paid rate on the Hilton site was around $200 a night. In NY, at this price, you can normally expect a dump. This is far from a dump! Also, before I continue, at this price, I'd probably stay here again. The price was this low because this DoubleTree is relatively new. They need to fill the rooms. However, assuming the price starts to move upward beyond the $250 range, in my opinion, this hotel starts to lose it's competitive edge. First off, let me say there are three key neighborhoods I like to stay in when I visit NY. One is Midtown, but specifically around 42nd St. around 5th Avenue; the second is around Union Square and the Flat Iron; and the third is Chelsea. Why? All of these areas offer great access to uptown and downtown cabs and subways depending on my need. Also, all have good bars and restaurants. Easy to get to and from. This hotel is in Upper Chelsea. For the money it's a good deal, but if the price goes up, the Hilton Garden Inn one block to the south is a much better option. First off, this hotel really does have SLOW elevators. It is 27 floors. Only two elvators are available. Ouch. On top of this, there is NO service elevator. Ouch. So you share with maid service and they stop on EVERY floor. There are also no mini-bars in the rooms. Most DoubleTree's have minibars, e.g. Full service. This is not a full service doubletree. Unlike the Hilton Garden Inn which has no Mini Bars, there is no Pantry and no Microwave or Fridge. So you are SOL if you need bottled water, etc. And yes, the rooms are small. The Lobby is REALLY tiny. Forget hanging out there for a long period of time. It's a stop and go place. The bar is also very small. The Hilton Garden Inn right behind this hotel has about the same size rooms, has a Pantry with food, has a fridge and a microwave. Also as a VIP Diamond, I am greeted at the Garden Inn with water. When I combine the lack of amenities with the slow elevators, small lobby, etc. price wise at the rate I paid, fine, I'll stay here. It is Nice as I said before. But, if the price goes up, the negatives are too great and I'd pick the Hilton Garden Inn over this hotel in a second. Mind you, if the price was not right and the Hilton Garden Inn was too expensive (which it does sell out) then I'd move to a different neighborhood. Just my 2 cents. Just fine for the money, but...

Reviews.Title: “Tucked away on 29th Street”
Reviews.Author: DEJinVA
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, less than a year old. Our room had a king bed with large flatscreen TV. No minifridge. Hotel was very clean, as were the rooms and bathroom. It is on 29th Street between 6th and 7th Avenues, about two blocks from Madison Square Gardens and Penn Station. The room was comfy and the staff very nice. There was a restaurant and bar, We didn't eat there but had a drink at the bar - expensive ($6.50 Bud and $9 glass of Rose, plus tax = $17 for two drinks). We discovered that drinks were this expensive everywhere except at delis and pizza restaurants. There were only two problems with the hotel: noise and elevator. Hallway noise and conversations would come into the room. Our comment card recommended to them they add noise insulation to the doors. The second problem was with the elevators. This is a tall, narrow hotel with approximately 220 rooms on 24 floors, There were only two elevators so at times there could be a wait of several minutes for a car. Outside of these two issues, we would recommend the hotel if you are in this part of town. Also, there is a Whole Foods market at 24th and 7th, so you can buy a sixpack of beer for less than the price of two beers at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service - Okay Room”
Reviews.Author: TravelVermonter
Reviews.Content: When these guys mess up they mess up big. They are not helpful for getting things fixed quickly and rely on you to figure it out yourself. They charged two of my credit cards for full price and wouldn't make any phone calls to get one of the transactions voided out. Last thing you want to have to deal with when traveling for business. Building is older and elevators are terribly slow. This hotel is nothing special, expensive, and has terrible service. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & clean; friendly staff; easy walk to Penn Station - but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: CoffeeFrappe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Doubletree hotel several nights in early November, for a combination business / leisure trip. Overall, it was very modern, clean, comfortable and featured all new amenities & digital TV, etc. Our room was on a higher floor, had 2 (comfortable) double beds, was quiet, and had a gorgeous view of the Empire state building. Really nice! It's an easy walk to Macy's and all the shopping, the subway, and Penn station. (So, if you are attending a concert at MSG, it's a great location!) Breakfast was included with my room, and they have a lovely restaurant. Staff was great - incredibly friendly and helpful. Also, I did not experience a problem with the elevator, and from talking to the staff, I understand the weekends (or very busy days), there can be problems with it.......However, my main issue was the very, very tiny room. I have lived in NYC and often stay in the city, but this room was extremely small - even for one person. The bathroom was very tight. I had to keep my cosmetics in the bathtub because there was absolutely no room to keep anything in the bathroom. Believe it or not, there was barely space to keep a toothbrush on the sink, as the shelf around the sink was almost non-existent. The closet was extremely compact, and since I had a different event to attend each night, I could not keep all of my clothes in it. My recommendation? If you are one (maybe two) persons, and don't have a lot of clothes or bags, then you can deal with it. Otherwise, stay at a hotel with a larger sized rooms, like the doubletree in times square that features suites -- or at least try to get a hotel with slightly bigger rooms. I can only hope this hotel will renovate & merge two of their rooms into one. That might solve the size problem!

Reviews.Title: “Nice one night stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: george00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in early November. The hotel is a very short walk to Penn Station which was very convenient. The hotel is located on a boring sidestreet. It is 5 blocks to Macys and other shops at Herald Square. I enjoyed the fact that it is a newer hotel, clean and was in good repair. Our room was one of the smallest that I have stayed in while in New York City. For a short stay it was fine. We never had to wait very long to use the elevators. Service was friendly. My Mom commented that the bed was one of the most comfortable that she had slept in. We had a room on a higher floor with a decent view. I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RLee3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great deal for the price and location. The rooms are clean, the staff is helpful and Chelsea is a fun area to stay in. The rooms weren't huge but that's a given in NYC. My only complaint were the elevators. They take FOREVER. We were on the 20 something floor and took the stairs a couple times because of the wait. Request a room on a lower floor to avoid that issue. Also, it's a newer hotel and if you take a taxi make sure your driver knows you're going to Chelsea and not Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel. friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: emg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in November. Was a bit wary after reading some negative reviews but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. 29th st is not much to look at but once inside the hotel you forget about that. The staff were really helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. We had a room on the 21st floor with 2 double beds which were extremely comfortable with 4 pillows each, lovely. Bathroom small but spotless with nice fresh towels daily. Hotel is only a short walk to Macys and Times Square, so quite central really. We took a yellow cab to Ground Zero (about 8 dollars) then went shopping in Syms where my son bought a lovely leather coat for $149 which was a great bargain as they had the same one in Century 21. which is also nearby. for $390. Would return to this hotel again !

Reviews.Title: “Please add another elevator”
Reviews.Author: mayorbarry
Reviews.Content: We got a (reasonably) good rate at $240 per night. The hotel is in kind of an odd area, not a ton around there except places selling hats and purses in bulk and some import/export places. The staff was helpful and professional. Every time we bumped into someone they asked how are stay was, etc. After our first night we returned to the room and the keys no longer worked. During the 3 night stay I heard 2 other people complaining about the same thing so its obviously an issue. The room (1006) was spotless and decently sized for a new york hotel room. The real issue is the lack of elevators. There are 2 for the entire hotel as well as the staff. The wait for the elevator was always a minute or 2, sometimes up to 5. If that doesn't sound long to you, you've never waited for an elevator that long. When it arrived it was inevitably packed and sometimes also had a maid or room service cart in there taking up 1/2 the space. I can't imagine what it would be like on an upper floor, probably a 15 minute commute from your front door to the entrance of the hotel including elevator wait and stopping at every floor. I know the hotel was almost full (2 rooms open) but this is obviously a major problem. I wouldn't stay here again for that reason

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tolopez
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel on a Friday and Saturday night. It's new, modern and clean. We took Amtrak to New York. The hotel was a short 3 block walk down 7th avenue and a left on 29th. When I turned down 29th I got a little concerned. It's one of those area's of the city that is slowly being gentrified. It's full of old trading companies and hold overs from years past. When I got half way down 29th street I saw the hotel and felt better. Check in was quick and we were in our room in about 5 minutes with warm chocolate chip cookies (a treat they give you at check-in). We were on the 22nd floor with a king size bed. The rooms are small, but for NY standards I would say they are about average. The room felt new and modern with beech furniture, a good size flat screen tv and crisp sheets. Our room faced 29th street and we could see int he Empire State building. The bathroom was small but clean and featured Neutrogena products. I found the hotel to be quiet and comfortable. The location was good, we could get everywhere in about 10 minutes by taxi. Most of our cab fares were $10 or less. The hotel does have a business center and gym. I didn't use either but I did see them.. They were nothing out of the ordinary. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would recommend this hotel especially if your catching a show or a game at the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Very mod, clean, convenient and near to Times Square.”
Reviews.Author: Lainey30
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to be staying at the Affinia Manhattan and between the hotel and our travel agent, they mucked up!! Anyway, we were offered this hotel and I must say it was nice. As a girl, I would not walk 29th street on my own in the dark however, once you have someone with you it is fine. Great location. Room was lovely. We were in 1103 and it was spacious as New York hotels go and the ensuite was really nice - no bath though but then didnt spend much time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: mrsm2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night, after booking the room that morning. The room was small but extremely clean and adequate for the two of us and looked as if it had been recently been refurbished. We paid under $200. for the night which was a real bargain. I would definitely stay there again, especially for the same rate. The only things that were somewhat of a problem was the inadequate elevators during the morning rush. My husband said that he had to wait for at least 15 minutes, and was not pleased since it delayed his arrival to work. I left later, but was annoyed at the racket the maids seemed to be making in the hallways. If I had planned on sleeping late, I would have definitely been annoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms. Ridiculously small.”
Reviews.Author: MrSmith100
Reviews.Content: Yes it is NY, and yes rooms can be somewhat small. But this is place was ridiculous. The room was big enough for a bed and a desk and that's about it. I'd expect this from a no-name local hotel, not from a DoubleTree. Also, the hotel is 23 stories. There are only 2 small elevators which hold maybe 6 people at a time. Which means during peak times, like at 8:30am, you wait forever. One day I waited for over 5 minutes for the elevator. When one finally showed up...too full for me to get into. It was ridiculous. Room Service: I ordered a burger and fries. When it arrived, the fries were cold and no ketchup/mustard was provided. Not the end of the world, but still when you're paying $25 for a burger, the least they could do is warm it up before bringing to your room and throw in a bottle of ketchup. The hotel is very new so everything looked good, it was clean, etc. And it is pretty good location if you want to see the sights, with several subway stations within a 5 minute walk. Still I would not stay there again given the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Service - Not in Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: SwamiDDT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is much more in the sketchy shopping/flower district than it is in Chelsea. I paid over $800 for a room and had worse service than $80 hotels. First, it is not in the best neighborhood. Second, the Bells just sat there while I unloaded luggage followed by simply pointing to where I can check in... I was in Business Casual attire, so it is not as if there was any reason to be snubbed. They do give you a nice cookie at check in. And lastly, after literally paying a total one night bill of something right near $870, they have the audacity to then charge you almost $10 for wireless service. Are you kidding me??? I have stayed at the Belnord Hotel on the upper west side for a couple hundred dollars and had better service. I highly recommend staying somewhere else....

Reviews.Title: “Really nice. Really.”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirlUs
Reviews.Content: Front Desk Staff? Friendly and efficient (and they give you those warm cookies). Room? Spotless. Bed? Very comfy, loads of pillows - the good kind. Bathroom? Nice tub you can actually take a bath in, plenty of hot water and great water pressure, full toiletries, and a nice, strong blowdryer that's not screwed to the wall. TV? Great reception AND plenty of channels. Parking? Alas, no, but the garage is just down the street @ $22 per night. Check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough room to swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: olig
Reviews.Content: Turned away at 12 noon and again at 5 pm as my room wasn't ready. Offered a soda as compensation. I know that the property is expensive in New York, but the room and the corridor was so small that you couldn't swing a cat in either place. Walls must be thin too 'cos I could hear the family talking in the adjacent room. The lobby, bar and restaurant were also small and congested. The building is tall and narrow, with only 2 lifts... which used by everyone, meaning a long wait. Is the hotel really in Chelsea...? Maybe just. Not far to the subway though.

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevator and slow receptionist. But they allowed my dog!”
Reviews.Author: Beersaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel with my husband and 5month old bulldog. (They allow dogs less than 30lbs) Parking is validated at Edison Garage, about 1.5 blocks down from the hotel. My advise is to bring rolling luggage. Attendants were accommodating when we asked to have our car accessible for items we might need later. Check in was at 3pm and we arrived at 245pm. Room was not ready until 3pm on the dot. Lobby was crowded with people who also had to wait for their rooms to be ready. Check out was similar, slow and inefficient. In room- I liked the variety of complimentary toiletries by Neutrogena which included a face cleanser and face moisturizer. Room also included a blowdryer. Pillows were plentiful, big and fluffy. I had to take my dog outside to urinate; couldn't wait any longer so decided to walk down 16 floors from my room. On our way up, the lobby was full and I was in line for the elevator. When the elevator came, some ignorant tourist cut in front of us with her big luggage. So, I had to walk up 16 flights back to my room. On my way, I saw the elevator dropping people off at the 3rd floor. I think I was going as fast as the elevator because it kept stopping at each floor. At least my dog got exercise. Bottom line, we stayed here because they let dogs (under 30lbs) stay. We will not return because my dog will be more than 30lbs soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value -- Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JFPMass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Doubletree Hotel Chelsea from 9/13 - 915, 2009. This is a small, new hotel that is within an easy walk to Times Square and and even shorter walk to Madison Square Garden, The Empire State Building and Macy's. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and the room, although small, very comfortable with a king-size bed desk and wardrobe. The bathroom was very small but adaquite and everything was spotlessly clean and fresh. We paid $132 for the Sunday night and $188 for the Monday night stay. A great vaule for NYC! We would gladly stay again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: karench14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubletree Hotel in Chelsea over the weekend of Sept. 12. It was about a 10 minute walk at most from Penn Station. Check in was fairly quick and then we were off to our room. The room is small compared to other hotels in other cities but for NY - it's normal and actually quite good. We got nervous about noise when we were about to enter our room. We were directly across from the elevator and then there was a lot of noise coming from one of the rooms down the hall. But when we entered the room and closed the door - the combination of the air conditioner and the walls made the hall barely audible! The reviews on here are true - the elevators are slow. But it's completely manageable and we just took the stairs from the 14th floor when we needed to get out (and didn't have baggage). Squeeze in when you get the chance! The location was great. Chelsea is such a fun area and we were able to walk to a lot of different places. Try Elmo for brunch which is a few blocks away! The fitness center had updated equipment which is a definite plus and hard to find in hotels! I believe it was all Precor. I love Doubletree cookies :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: SunnyPilot
Reviews.Content: We encountered a few hiccups at check-in but they were handled properly by Helen (Front Desk Supervisor). Location, not the best street but a few blocks down you are right on Madison Square Garden. Hotel is a typical New York Building, corridors are narrow and rooms are under 300 sq.ft.. Restaurant staff was superb! Overall nice hotel, they are still trying to get everything up and running as they just open.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and affordable Manhattan hotel”
Reviews.Author: joseph340
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an affordable, clean, and comfortable room in Manhattan, this Doubletree--along with it's sister Hilton-brand properties in the neighborhood--can't be beat. Service is top notch...I stayed for one night, and then returned for two a couple of days later. The front-desk clerk greeted me by name when I arrived for my second stay...very impressive. Otherwise, my favorite thing about this hotel is that it offers 150-channel cable tv, complete with an interactive programming guide...that may be the last thing on the mind of most people visiting NYC, but I spend 100+ nights a year in hotels. It was a pleasant change from the 20-30 channels that you find at most properties. On the downside, the lifts are terribly slow...it wasn't so bad during my first stay, but when I returned it seemed like only one of the two would move at any given time. At one point spent over five minutes waiting, while the one lift stayed on floor 12 the entire time! And I agree w/ previous reviews, it does seem quite ridiculous to charge $10 for internet access, especially when the nearby Hampton and Hilton Garden Inn are essentially identical hotels, but offer it for free. Finally, the surrounding neighborhood isn't all that appealing, but at the same time I never felt unsafe...besides, it's a short walk to more traveler-friendly areas. Penn Station is only about a 5-minute walk away, so if you're arriving at either Newark or JFK airport, you can save your money on the cab fare and just take the train.

Reviews.Title: “Not Enough Elevators, Fire Code Violations”
Reviews.Author: Alonzo_DeVaughn
Reviews.Content: Clearly the NYC Building Dept. should have never approved plans for this hotel. What were they thinking??? At 27 floors there are only TWO, small-cab, not-so-fast elevators, and no service elevator which means long waits in the morning and afternoon/evening, and sharing elevators with bins of dirty linens, garbage bags and luggage. Worse, the lack of hallway space on the guest floors means the housekeeping staff have to pile bags and bags of linens in the fire escape stairwells overnight, often blocking passage between floors. I used to live in NYC and have lived in high rises my entire adult life and can assure you this is a fire code violation. I showed pictures to the assistant manager who was very nice and apologetic and promised to bring it up at the next staff meeting. Still, it makes you wonder what else is going wrong. Other issues: no minibar, nor mini-refrigerator; no liquor license; ice machines on only every third or fourth floor (if you can get to them through the bags of linens). Now, the good part. The staff are friendly and realize the problems the architects and whoever runs real estate at Hilton left them and their guests. I feel sorry for them that they have to work at such a badly designed facility. I'd say OK for tourists with time on their hands; would be a disaster for a business trip where you have to be downstairs in 5 or 10 minutes. Another plus: great location, at least for me. Convenient to Chelsea where I have many friends, mid-town, Penn Station, whatever. Yes, the block is a little "industrial" -- lots of low-end wholesale fabric and fashion accessory showrooms -- but Fashion Institute of Technology is down the street and there is some sort of FIT student dorm nearby so energy on the street even late at night. OK for tourists; would be a disaster for time-sensitive business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced in quiet neighborhood yet walkable”
Reviews.Author: tanka1
Reviews.Content: Fully renovated older Hilton and typically small rooms for Manhattan yet nicely situated for quiet nights. There was an interesting view of the top floors of the Empire State building from the window. Staff at front desk were accomodating. My only complaint: I still don't understand why these major brands still charge for internet - it is almost like charging for a shower in the morning. Perhaps it is about losing revenues by not using the telephones in the room.

Reviews.Title: “a diamond in the city”
Reviews.Author: katktoure
Reviews.Content: After much searching I found the doubletree. It has only been open for a couple of months. It has a nice walk or short cab drive fron Penn Station. The staff is limited but very nice and they offer you cookies all day every day. We first had a King room because they were soldout of doubles. The room was a very nice size with a nice bathroom. Not at all the broom closet you usually think of in NY. The room looked new and the bed was very comfortable. the only downer was that the wireless was not free and the business center stayed full with only 2 computers and during peak hours the elevators were slow. I would stay here agine in a heart beat. one of the best deals in town

Reviews.Title: “Brand New DoubleTree in Midtown - Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Roddy_Rod
Reviews.Content: A brand new DoubleTree right in the heart of midtown - what more can I ask for! I booked this room for a leisure trip at a fantastic rate and was happy with everything. Rooms were all brand new with major new amenities. The only downside were that the rooms were small, but that is to be expected in NY and I didn't really mind the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good new hotel”
Reviews.Author: reneeDC11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three girlfriends in one of the 2-double rooms, on which we got a great deal. The room was small, pretty cramped with our bags, but we made it work - we were there only one night. And it's NYC people, the rooms are small! I agree that the elevators take a long time. Everything was new and beautiful in the room and bathroom. Very comfortable beds. Front desk was very nice and tried hard when we were looking for pizza delivery at 2am. Our extra towel request took about 20 minutes. They stored our bags after we checked out - very hassle free. The major con is that the neighborhood is a little run down- the garment district was seedier than I thought it would be, but a quick walk to Flatiron and Madison Square Park all the major stores around there. All in all, I might stay here again with another great deal, but might think twice because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “washcloth was only towel in room for 2 days!”
Reviews.Author: yippee1014
Reviews.Content: checked into the hotel on sunday. could see immediately the hotel was understaffed, the entire lobby was filled with luggage waiting to be checked &there was only 1 poor, sweating bellhop trying to take care of everything. one the second day, my room was not cleaned & after numerous calls to the front desk & promises that it would be taken care of immediately, it never happened. This was day 1 of drying myself with a washcloth since it was the only clean towel in the room. Day 2, my room was cleaned but no towels in the bathroom. again calls to the front desk & to housekeeping. needless to say, by the time they were finally delivered it was day 2 of drying myself with a washcloth. My newspaper was not delivered on the second day & when i told the front desk i was told to walk down the street so i could buy one. i actually asked the front desk if i was registered as a guest in the hotel, since i wasn't getting any service, and i was informed i was.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an average NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tulanecpt
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small (~220 sq.ft.) but well appointed. Comfortable bed Still 'buggy" from beig new. Lots of carts, garbage bags, and confused staff. Elevators are too small, too slow, and too few for a 26 floor hotel Full service restaurant is a nice amenity for this type of hotel in this area No open space or common area anywhere Location seems safe but many seedy characters roam the streets in the evening A 5 minute walk to Penn Station, Madison Sq. Garden Overall, decent for a solo traveler for a couple days that has business in the area, once the service matures.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: amberhariton
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel after I checked into my room at the Hotel Penn right down the street on 7th ave. I was desperate for another room at another hotel. The two ladies at the front desk were so nice and gave us a very fair rate. The rooms are small, but hello - this is New York! And, I've stayed in smaller... Our room was spotless and I don't know why other reviewers had a problem with service - we got amazing service. Every time we saw an employee in the hallway or elevator, they said hello and asked us how our stay was going. With a small child, we had some extra requests from housekeeping and we always got everything right away. The neighborhood is great. An easy walk to Penn Station and the Chelsea galleries (I even passed where the film the Martha Stewart Show on my walks). I've walked to Times Square twice and it too is an easy walk from this hotel. Also, lots of fashion/wholesale stuff around. Free internet in the lobby.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree Hotel Chelsea New York City
HotelInfo.Address: 128 West 29th Street, New York City, NY 10001
